name: Cheyenne Botanic Gardens
address: 710 S Lions Park Dr, Cheyenne, WY 82001, USA
reviews: Such an amazing place for this small town to have! Great place to meet a friend and hang out. The kids loved the fish and birds and seeing all the amazing plants. Truly a must see for Cheyenne.
A perfect respite from the day.  Come and reflect read a book and have a nice cup of tea.  We saw a stained glass exhibit the afternoon we went. Recommend!
Went to a Birthday party today. The party room was spacious are very nice. Everything was clean and bright. The temperature was great. Thank you for a very pleasant experience.

What a wonderful experience.  Such an exceptional selection of exotics in a small, but beautiful facility.  Wyoming can be proud of this garden!  A real banana tree with a bunch of bananas and a Choi pond that is perfect.  The blossom's scent from the citrus tree added a special effect to our experience.  The conversation with the host was great.

One of my favorite places to go when I am visiting family in Cheyenne wyoming. I love all of the different plants and the size of the fish in the ponds! My nephew loves to come here all of the time so its great to enjoy something i love with him. The banana trees had bunches of fruit and the air was very nice. Overall I recommend everyone visit their local botanical gardens. I even got the inspiration to grow a monstresa plant in my house! They have rotating showcases and kids entertainment as well. We saw a bonsai exhibit that was very interesting.

name: Cheyenne Depot Museum
reviews: New to Cheyenne and took the kids on a cold wintery day.  We all loved it! The loved the model trains upstairs💜

Sadly, the staff was very unfriendly, rude, and demeaning. We tried to go to the museum, but power was out. Rather than being helpful or offering any alternatives, the staff was rude. I understand they had nothing to do with the power being out, but courtesy was far from a strength. At this point, not interested in going back, even at a time that the power is working.
Very cool place.  Learn a little bit about the Wild West here and enjoy lunch & a beer next door.  Nice people.  I'm a fan of Cheyenne.

This is a great, fun, and educational place to come and learn about Wyoming's railroad past. The model railroad upstairs is quite impressive in its scale, and the mini model railroad that you can operate is quite fun for the little ones. I also like going upstairs and looking out the windows out at the railroad tracks and envisioning what the depot must have been like back in its prime with all the trains and passengers. Definitely worth a visit.

We decided to visit this attraction based on overwhelmingly positive Google reviews as well as one of our kids love trains.  For the cost, $8/adult, this is an extremely small museum.  Upstairs they have a really cool model railroad set up, however, upon our arrival, a Saturday, there was no one available to run the trains.  

We understand the running of the model trains is dependent on volunteers, so would recommend calling ahead of time if you plan to visit to ensure you get to see them.  

We did like the chairs upstairs so you can watch trains that come through the rail yard.  We were lucky to get to see one come through.

name: Cheyenne Frontier Days Old West Museum
reviews: Modern. Clean. Well lighted. Spacious. Artifacts - and they are more than numerous - are nicely restored and very well arranged and displayed. We look forward to visiting again.

Very friendly staff. I felt like I was stepping back in time with the old carriages and artifacts. Great gift shop. We learned a lot about the rodeo culture here and how important Frontier Days is to this town. Great stop while we were visiting Wyoming.

If a good museum is your thing then this one is going to transport you back to days of old. The carriages are a great way to spend time contemplating how the ladies got in out. I personally think that could be the start of the custom of opening the door for a lady.  If you have a hour or four stop in check it out.
So much history packed into a small space.  Well laid out, great information to real along with the display items.  Great way to spend an afternoon and learn about Cheyenne!
Great place to go see a rodeo. Also the sight where Lane Frost was killed. There is a monument of his there to show respect.

name: Big Boy Steam Engine 4004
reviews: Very cool to be able to see one of the eight remaining largest steam engines ever built.  It is stored in a beautiful a park in Cheyenne.  There's not much you can do other than look at the fenced in train and read about the Big Boy on a board, but still definitely worth visiting if you are in the area.

They say only 8 of 25 Big Boys built are still around. Heck, I saw 27 on this trip alone and I wasn’t even looking for them. I have one in my backyard. Not in my area backyard, my actual backyard. I stole it, borrowed it, Engine #4999. Logistics were a little tricky, but I was determined to make it work. Don’t tell Union Pacific, cause I’m not giving it back. Neat train display in a mediocre park. My display is better. 
🚂🚂🚂🚂
Love this park all year long! Personally enjoy quiet time on a snowy winter day.
Easy access in the park, borrow my Dad to give you details on the locomotive design and functionality and including production history.

The steam engine is in a park near the UP Steam shop and the Cheyenne Muesuem for trains as well.  The train is near the tennis courts in side a half height fence, so you can't touch the train.  Its huge as most people know.  This area of Wyoming has been getting lots of rain so the grass is swampy now.  There is an entrance to a parking lot on the south west side.  It is surrounded by busy roads.  Kids had a great time.

name: Wyoming State Capitol Building
reviews: I love the capitol building. Such a beautiful, impressive building in a quaint, quiet part of town. The setting is wonderful. Quite accessible by car and foot. Since it is downtown by the state museum and county library, we often drive by.

When we visited here this Spring there was some construction work going on there. But we could take some pictures and drive around the Capitol building. We also spent sometime in the nearby areas. A great location with so much of historical importance. This is the capitol Building of the equality state Wyoming. It was a good experience !
love the capitol. I didnt know where to go, but a quick phonecall was all it took. the people here are great.
The restoration is simply wonderful. Tell your friends, go see it - you will be surprised and pleased especially if you spent any time there 4+ years ago.

A beautiful piece of architechture and history! I was hoping to find information as to the source of the materials used for architecture and decorating/trim. More information on the history of the state in general would be fun!

name: Cheyenne Depot Plaza
address: 1 Depot Square Capitol &, W 15th St, Cheyenne, WY 82007, USA
reviews: Truly enjoyed our visit here. Depot museum is worthy of being a reason to visit Cheyenne on its own. Loved the history and be sure to visit the model train area upstairs - incredible recreation of mining lines of Colorado.
Love Friday Nights On The Plaza!!! My 3-yr-old boy loves the concerts and asks to "go to music" just about every day. 😁
Really need to ho visit this place when in Cheyenne. The museum is very I interesting.
Very beautiful area, must see small Court yard for tourists like us! It's also a nice place to find some of the big boots!
We had breakfast at A Good Egg. It was very good, loved the ham. Definitely will go back and try lunch.

name: Paul Smith Children's Village at the Cheyenne Botanic Gardens
address: 616 S Lions Park Dr, Cheyenne, WY 82001, USA
reviews: What a beautiful garden! A great hands' on experience for my kids. It's huge, though - wish we'd had more time to go through and see everything.
Really neat place! Everything is and interesting for children! Would love to visit again!
Love coming here. Fun and interactive activities. Great staff.
Such a nice little area for the children. It is so well designed and stimulates the creativity.
Excellent place to see not only for children but adults as well.

name: Cowgirls of the West Museum
reviews: If you visit Cheyenne and love the rodeo. You must stop here
Explore the rich history of cowgirls roll in early America. Lots of great photographs and information, beautiful costumes
The people that staff this quaint place are the best! Friendly and knowledgable. The displays are wonderful.
Loved it. Lots of displays to read. Doesn't take long if you just want to poke around. Video about 20 minutes long is entertaining and has great footage.

We randomly found this museum and I'm glad we did.  What a cool hidden gem!  All about the history of women in the west - as homesteaders, mothers, businesswomen, rodeo stars... this was an eyeopening visit and I'm glad I found it with my daughters.

name: Warren ICBM & Heritage Museum
address: 401 N Champagne Dr #31, Francis E. Warren AFB, WY 82001, USA
reviews: Nice museum. My husband really enjoyed it. He is active duty Army and my father is retired Air Force. My father enjoyed the pictures. Nice little gift shop. Bigger than it looks from the outside. Very friendly employees who are very knowledgeable. Enjoyed the experience. I was surprised that it wasn't just missile related items. There are also some uniforms and furniture and other related items from different eras in the military. A lot of history about the base. Definitely worth seeing if you're in the Cheyenne area and love military museums

What a wonderful museum to visit at FE Warren Air Force Base Museum. It was an honor for me because my father served at FE Warren Missile Wing . The tour of the museum will teach and show everyone about the history of Former Calvary post To the present day US Air Force base and how the base  contribute To the fence of the United States during the Cold War into the present date. The staff and the tour was excellent.

This place is wonderful. If you have a military ID you can access the base to visit the museum, others need to call the museum first. The museum has both the history of the base from when it was an Army Fort, to now when it is a missile base. There are great exhibits, one room is dedicated to kids, so they can interact with historic items, such as they can sit at an actual console used to launch missiles, and they can launch one too.
So interesting and fun to see everything,  just a little disappointed there was no close captioning.
Love these historic homes.

name: Nelson Museum of the West
reviews: I thought it was pretty cool!  This is a man's personal collection of knick-knacks from the old west! A little bit lacking in information but there is lots to see!
Very interesting and informative. A lot of great displays.
Amazing displays of western artifacts and hunting trophies
Best museum ever! So many actual artifacts!
This was an awesome little museum. Very fun to see the sparkled and metallic saddles

name: Mylar Park
reviews: Decent little park.  Small pond with lots of geese and ducks.  Good walking path around the park.  This park also has a Frisbee golf course.
Great little park. It has a nice pond and it isn't crowded. The play area is great for kids. The bathrooms are always pretty clean, which I like. Hidden gem, highly recommend.
Great park for did walking. People are friendly and happy there.
Beautiful, small park with lots of open space, volleyball net, bathrooms, event pavilion, small playground with swing all up against a disc golf course.

I like Mylar park. It is for the most part clean and well maintained. The little pond that is fed by crow creak could benefit from some attention and landscaping. The disc golf course is not to bad. With some careful throws you can even keep the discs out of the less than clean pond. Over all I like the park

name: Cheyenne Street Railway Trolley
reviews: Drivers were excited and proud to tell the town's history and stories.  I had a fantastic time
We got a good deal on Groupon for this Trolley tour and it was very informative. However, the trolley really needed a better air conditioner. Beware: the tour guide's humor is a little dark.
This is where you start your Cheyenne adventure
Nice way to get an overview of the town, we used it on our first day to scope out our visit. Dewey was our rooting tooting Trolley driver and tour guide. A very colorful fellow.
Railroad museum is great. Plan on 1 to 1 1/2 hours to work through exhibits

name: Epic Escape Game Cheyenne
reviews: It was great fun, I really want to see this place thrive because I feel it is a great addition to Cheyenne. The escape room was great fun, the only suggestion I have is more puzzles, but still, it was a ton of fun. Thank you

Really really cool!!!! My friend and I did a Medium level room, the football locker room. It's very challenging for someone that hasn't ever done this before. I highly recommend doing this. It's $28 per person and you have 1 hour in a room. There's a few minutes of explanation and prepping before you enter the room. By the way, my friend is 30, I'm 32, both prior military, we are out doors type of guys and this was still a blast.
First time going to a escape room we had a blast. Great way to spend an hr

This place has one of the harder escape rooms I've been too. The atmosphere wasn't as submersive as others I've seen but the clues are challenging and fun. The lady that runs this place has a great sense of humor and makes the experience good. There are usually about 4 to 5 rooms to choose from so it's easy to get in with just your group and not have to share with strangers. The online registration process is smooth.
The staff was fantastic with our group, definitely a hidden gem in Cheyenne!

name: Messenger's Old West Museum
reviews: Amazing place to check out if your visiting Cheyenne
This museum has odd and rare collections of History of the great Wild West
It's in a storage facility and the exterior belies the interior.  They have some very interesting displays, something to appeal to virtually everyone.
You have to see it to believe it... Small but packed.

Messengers Old West Museum is a gem full of treasures to discover at every turn.  We were fortunate to have a guided tour, adding history and stories to each display.  It is a tiny jewel among all the big museums we visited.  Don't miss out on this one when you are in Cheyenne.  It's a perfect memory!  Thank you, Mr. Messenger, for sharing your family treasures with us.

name: Wyoming State Museum
reviews:
This place is awesome. There is no entry fee and they have many hands on exhibits. There is even a room that allows children to play and touch stuff.
I recommend you go just for the sandbox. There are hundred of really interesting items on exhibit. Please donate when you enter. Every dollar, quarter, dime, and penny help persevere this wonderful history. They also have dinosaur bones.

What a fabulous museum! A great tour through the rich history of the State of Wyoming, from prehistoric times to present. The kiddos (7, 9, 11 & 13) were fully fascinated and entertained as well. We will definitely be back to see it all again next time we’re in town!

Pro tip: be sure to check out the amazing interactive topography display! Such an awesome exhibit!!
It’s not big but it covers pretty much all you need to know about the state of Wyoming. Besides, the environment is children friendly and it’s educational. Recommended for kids and adults alike.
This is a fun museum. I wish we'd had more time to do a thorough walk through. My kids loved the parts we saw.

Fun and educational place to visit. Like the large display bison when you walk in to be greeted. The exhibits are interesting,  and the kids love the interactive room, where you get to see, hear, smell, and touch stuff. That's my kids' favorite part. Worth a visit.

name: Wyoming Historic Governors' Mansion
reviews: Had been meaning to visit this for years! Surprised at how large the rooms were for such an old structure, beautiful antique furnishings. Not handicap accessible, many stairs. Self guided tour, information spots to text for information throughout home.
Wow! Incredible preservation of history. So much to learn and see here. A must visit in Cheyenne, Wyoming. Absolutely wonderful.
Very beautiful and full of history. That's awesome!

Well-maintained, fascinating, and free. Different rooms are restored to a variety of time periods. The staff know some fascinating trivia and are very fun to talk to. Great for small groups and history enthusiasts.
Excellent site lot of history

name: Southeast Wyoming Welcome Center
address: 5611 High Plains Road, Cheyenne, WY 82007, USA
reviews:
Always clean, always visible even in pretty bad weather, always cool to explore! 
 Large, clean bathrooms. Parking has never been an issue. Staff are nice. Pretty area! 
 If you need to make a stop, don't pass this one. They are expanding the sidewalk! Can't wait to see how it grows.

Wow! I've never seen such a well planned and interesting welcome center before. Like a small museum. Clean and spacious. There are little picnic shelters because- Watch out for Wyoming wind! The landscaping is attractive. And of course, the place is just off the highway. Perfect.
Nice place. Lady at the counter was very nice and helpful. I took away 1 star for the creepy greasy Mason guy. One of the nicest welcome centers. Clean bathrooms, museum, and beautiful grounds.

The prettiest welcome area we have seem yet. My husband loved all the ram earth walls and all the details that were done in designing the building. The staff member behind the counter was very  chatty and engaging.
Restrooms were very clean and smelled great.
You have to stop here and go inside while they are open take your kids they will love it! And everyone there are so nice.

name: Terry Bison Ranch Resort
address: 51 I-25 Frontage Rd, Cheyenne, WY 82007, USA
reviews: Amazing ranch with wonderful staff. They have a big gift shops with really interesting things. We left with many souvenirs. The price to stay in a cabin was unbelievably cheap! We also had an amazing horseback ride that went into several states. Gorgeous views! My mom and I look forward to visiting again soon!

Not a lot to it at first glance, but a really cool spot for adults and kids. Definitely not a while day thing, but a couple hours to take the train and roam a bit. Then... grab some food at the restaurant. It was pretty tasty. Also, an awesome 2 piece band was playing when I was there.

Neat place that we stumbled upon driving from CO to WY. We enjoyed seeing and photographing the animals. We appreciated the train ride to feed the buffalo and saw lots of prairie dogs on the way. The train ride was bumpy and cold, but well worth the $15. They were kind enough to do an early (unscheduled) tour just for us. Would definitely recommend.

If you’re here for bison encounter experience, you won’t be disappointed. I won’t expect fancy restaurants or majestic barn, it’s a ranch after all. Bison has a wild side which we better keep a safe distance in places like state parks. But the bisons here are so tamed like pets. Hope that doesn’t misguide the tourists.
Really cool experience! Take the train ride to feed the bison. You won't be disappointed, other than the fields of Buffalo chips, feeding them is really cool for adults and the kids.

name: Cheyenne - Parks Division
address: 4603 Lions Park Dr, Cheyenne, WY 82001, USA
reviews: Nice park with a disc golf course, playground, a few shelters with picnic tables and restroom (porta-potty in winter), horseshoe pits and pond with ducks and geese. Smally park (across the street) has a few baseball hoops.

I love the parks. They are what make Cheyenne a great place to live. I wish they would attempt to enforce the leash law. So tired of dogs approaching my leashed dogs. I've told a couple  of people about the leash law and they've been outrageously nasty back. (Hey, mom chicks with four unleashed dogs. Screaming OH MY GOD at the top of your lungs only makes you look crazy.) I appreciate the qork the Parks Division does to keep the parks beautiful despite all the use they take.
Mylar park always provides a beautiful view and rest stop during bicycle rides.
Great park.  There is a lake, playground equipment, picnic area and the botanic garden.  There is also ample free parking.
Very friendly and helpful staff!

name: Wyoming National Guard Museum
address: 624 E Pershing Blvd, Cheyenne, WY 82001, USA
reviews: Had a neat tank and a bunch of other stuff
Small but full of interesting history. Worth a short visit.

This museum is especially close to my heart as my grandfather is buried right behind it on the military side of the cemetery. The Wyo National Guard Museum is the home of alot of cool stuff from wars past and present. I'm sure you'll have a fun and educational time. Unfortunately they are closed for renovations but I think they'll be reopened some time in early 2018 before spring. I can't wait to see it when they reopen..
Great place to see some history
Great history and good guides

name: Curt Gowdy State Park
address: 1264 Granite Springs Rd, Cheyenne, WY 82009, USA
reviews: Wonderful place to hike. I prefer the trails throughout the trees. Only reason I didn't give it five stars was that the waterfall was very crowded and I did not enjoy that it was so populated.
Killer trail system, one of my favorite bike trips ever.  Camping spots are fantastic and the lakes are beautiful.   Wyoming people are the best, so nice and laid back.  Can't wait to go again.
Ice fishing was great on Crystal. Some open water, but the ice is about 10" thick. Two of us got 8 rainbows and one brown in a little over 2 hours.

The RV spots are huge and spread apart. We paid $35 for a single night stay. Partial hookups (50amp and water). Spot right next to the water.

The roads are gravel/dirt but easy to navigate. The site was reasonably level. There's a dumpster and a very basic restroom with a typical camping hole in the ground for a toilet. The restroom was clean but very smelly.

It was nice being on the lake with the views but we took our kids down to the water to skip rocks and ended up leaving pretty quickly with all the goose poop and feathers everywhere.

We were hoping to stay closer to Cheyenne for the annual Cheyenne Frontier Days, but we were happy to have a beautiful site to stay instead of a cramped RV campground closer to town.

The lakes are really nice here. The picnic spots and camping areas are well spaced, so although others are there, you are not crowded. It is a short drive from Cheyenne, so it is easy to take a one day break, if you would like. The areas seems to be well kept. Fishing is good, mostly trout.

name: Aesthetic Dentistry, P.C.
reviews: I enjoy going to my dentist's office. They take good care of my teeth AND, they are very kind to me!  Many people don't like going to the dentist, I love going to my dentist. I highly recommend Dr. DZIARDZIEL and his staff.

This Dentist office is by far the best one I have ever been to! 
The staff is so nice and welcoming and the vibe is so comforting.
The dentist's are all committed to providing the best care and a positive experience for patients!

I was referred to Aesthetic Dentistry by Katina for a bite issue I’m having and was seen today by Dr D and Lisa  and within 5 min he recognized my bite was off and did some minor adjustments and have never felt so much better.. I recommend this dental practice to everyone looking for a great dental office!
I always have a great experience. Everyone is so nice and make me feel at ease. I recommend you guys to all my friends.

I have been a patient at Aesthetic Dentistry for several years now, and have always been more than pleased with the entire staff. Wait time has always been short, and the work that I‘ve had done has always been exceptional.

name: Abraham Lincoln Memorial Monument
address: 136 US Frst Service Rd 705 A, Laramie, WY 82070, USA
reviews: Stopped in the dark and was cold. So I didn't walk around to see monument & info booth was closed. Semi parking has to walk far to get to building and parking lot and sidewalks partially iced still. But it was clean inside and decent amount of parking.
Really cool place to make a pit stop when on the road. Really cool to get up close to the structure itself. Great learning experience for the kids.
Always love looking at this monument when passing. The rest area is clean and there's lots of Sherman Hill history inside of it. Check it out!

Really great place and so much information written on various interesting boards. The Visitor Center is also filled with a lot of informative stuff displayed everywhere. They have a well equipped screen section too inside. The Lincoln statue is placed on a huge tall rocks structure. Restrooms are very clean and overall this is a great place to stop for a while or have your packed lunch and then start driving with a fresh mind !
There's not much too it. Nice little rest stop but would benefit from just about anything(heck even a vending machine would improve it) very windy but a good place to meet.

name: Rocky Mountain Herbarium
address: 1000 E University Ave, Laramie, WY 82071, USA
reviews: Wonderfully tranquil spot on the University campus where you can relax and enjoy a great collection of botanical specimens.
Time in energy and the work that all the folks that keep this going is impressive. It's a little space but it's beautiful and very educational about some of the local fauna

This garden is magic.  Especially on a very cold day when you can walk out of sub zero weather and into a greenhouse filled with flowering plants.  The staff is nice.  There are a few tables and chairs.  They have a coffee and tea station.
A sample from all over the world. Worth visiting.
I love plants 😭

name: Ames Brothers Monument
reviews: Not the most exciting attraction. Makes you wonder if this was an afterthought to the Lincoln one down the road or vice versa. Would be far more interesting if there was an accompanying museum, but they probably blew the budget on the rock!

In the middle of nowhere, this thing pops up. Kind of cool. The kids loved the prairie dogs and trying to climb it. Cool piece of history. No bathrooms or water. Worth it if you want to see something out of the ordinary.

Two brothers decide to build a pyramid.  And the good news is, it's still here for us to enjoy.

We found the pyramid from a list of roadside attractions we came up with for our Houston-to-Vancouver drive.  

The story and legacy are intersting.  Seeing how civilization (and the train line) moved away from the pyramids gives you a hands-on understanding of how development of the west changed so much.

An extra benefit to stopping at the pyramids is the desolate surroundings.    When we were there, I could hear the noise of a train miles and miles away (no visible sign of rail tracks on our way to the site).  The surrounding land can only be described as "plains".  The land is not being worked, no farms, no ranches, it's just the pains of the west.  

Really enjoyable I would now drive out of my way to visit if I were anywhere close.

This is so cool and it is so much larger than I expected it to be. I expected a small rock pile but this is an enormous! Definitely worth going out to see. The road is a little bumpy but easily traveled by car.
It is on a dirt road but it's well maintained.

name: Red Mountain Open Space
address: 799 Red Canyon Rd, Wellington, CO 80549, USA
reviews: Absolutely beautiful open space but be advised there is virtually no shade. The terrain is very diverse and the trails are on the easy side of moderate. It's fascinating to see the old homesteads.
Get there early. There is no tree cover so it can get a bit warm. Remote place which makes it nice and quiet.
It a great place for hiking and horseback riding.  So much fun!!!!! Only reason it's not 5 starts is that there is no potable water for the average person.  Pack it in or bring a Lifestraw.
Beautiful open space film of rolling hills and small canyons. There's not much trees or other shelters in addition to what's at the trailhead, so pack accordingly. Also, no dogs allowed.

This is an amazing area that features very interesting geographical features such as a ridge with multiple layers of rocks that represent different periods in time. You can see where water has worn down the stone. Very beautiful and I would highly recommend seeing it if you have an opportunity.

name: University of Wyoming Geological Museum
reviews:
I was blown away by some of the displays and interactivity of the place. The cards that allow you to see 3D images through the app? I've been to some big name museums and even they don't do anything like that!

I gladly bought a shirt from the museum and cannot wait to tell people where I got it. If you are even a tiny bit interested in this kind of stuff you have to stop by.
Hard to find, small, but pretty neat.  Nice quick stop for a road trip.
Small, but fun museum. Has some interactive things for kids. Really like the AR sandbox that shows how water flows on mountains
Kids had a great time. Main attraction was an augmented reality sand box that allowed them to see how water flowed between different elevations and changes in landscape...
I was amazed at the amount of original fossils they have in their tremendous displays!

name: University of Wyoming Art Museum
address: Centennial Complex, 2111 E Willett Dr, Laramie, WY 82071, USA
reviews:
Exhibits are always interesting, beautiful, and well curated. Plus it is free, so everyone should take advantage of it and stop by! 

As a student I really loved the teaching gallery because I think it is such a cool and innovative thing to incorporate into coursework.
Unlike the other university mueseam it frequently changes exhibits making return trips more worthwhile.  It isn't just student work as well they will bring in displays from all over the place.
Great exhibits,  people were accommodating as our grandsons art was in a lower level not normally open on weekends, but they let us in.
Always amazing work with helpful folks!

My kids who are only four and six were so captivated by this Museum that we ended up going about every other week for 3 months. They have very cool displays that rotate out very cool guest speakers and vest guest performers and artists. The staff that works there is very patient and love to talk and help us out and educate.

name: Lory State Park
address: 708 N Co Rd 25G, Bellvue, CO 80512, USA
reviews:
Wonderful place to go exploring. Whether you're looking for a long day hike or a simple meander through nature, this is your place.
$9 daily admission fee but other than that, everything is free. The visitor center is a great place to bring kids, where they can learn about the wildlife and Natives of the area. You can also pick up a map of the area with the trails and the friendly employees there can answer any of your questions. A log book is there as well, where people from all over can record their visit.
You can choose to hike on the reservoir side or go up the mountain. These pictures were taken in early March.

Very sweet place to get lost in. I had time for a quick hike and was very glad I did. The views were incredible. The staff at the entrance was very helpful. I want to come back and hit the more advanced trails. Definitely worth the trip!!

We went on a wonderful hike Christmas morning to see the sunrise from Arthur's Rock. The trails were well marked but a few parts were slippery from the snow last month. It took us a little longer since it was dark so we only got to the first overlook by sunrise, but it was the perfect spot in the end. We will definitely come back to do more of the trails! The trail had plenty of signs and we're well maintained.

Took a stroll along an easy path however I should have had boots and yaktraks. I slid all over the place on the red clay paths. Great place to sit and enjoy the quiet and the beauty of the red rock cliff walls. I will be visiting in the spring time to walk and see more wildlife.

Lory State Park is one of my favorite destinations in the Fort Collins area, not only because of the scenery, but because of the climbing. Im not going to say that the Rock is my favorite, in fact I really dislike it. It’s very heavy grain granite, and you often pop feet on the slippery crystals which simultaneously puncture your fingers while offering surprisingly low friction. Friction improves in the cold weather, but it’s still not amazing. Despite the crusty rock that can at times be chossy, the South Face and the Overlook offer some very interesting and technical climbs, with the unique Arthur’s Rock style. The bouldering is also quite good, but the rock definitely takes some getting used to. 

All in all, Lory is a great place for some chunky granite climbing.

name: Pawnee National Grassland
reviews: When the weather's nice it's a great. Walk for hours and not see another person. All natural, like before the settlers got here. Great place to sit and pull my thoughts together for the upcoming week. Get rid of work and let some nature come on.

Nice way to enjoy Colorado without dealing with the crowds in the mountains.  Not sure about the summer months, but if you go at dusk in November you may not see any other people.  The spectre of civilization is very apparent in all the industrial operations and private land in the area, but it is still a great way to experience the vastness of Colorado's plains with relative freedom.

It sucks the amount of private property you have to meander around.  But still worth it. A nice place to see the prairie as it used to be. Hunter antelope here also. Was a bit challenging due to the limited public land, but was a great hunting trip.

Drive out to Pawnee every week or so to practice shooting. The only con is people don't pick up their own shells and targets. Come on people pack out what you pack in. Help keep Pawnee clean and accessable for everyone.

I love the Pawnee National Grassland.  Pawnee Buttes, Ghost Towns,... There is a lot to do out there if you look for it.  Beware though that its big and fairly flat without a ton of signs or landmarks.  You can get lost easily.  Fill the car before heading out too.. Gas stations are far and few.  Overall a great place for the whole family.

name: Rocky Mountain National Park
reviews: This was an amazing experience! Perfect for people of all ages. We saw a ton of wild life, and the trails were a ton of fun! The view was spectacular.  I wish we would have came during the summer instead of winter because more things are open and hours back riding is offered during the summer months. But I highly recommend visiting this park, you won't regret it!

We have been to Rocky Mountain NP many times. It is one of our favorite places to go to. We have hiked to many lakes and most of the waterfalls. We have gone to RMNP many times at the end of May when the road opens for the first time. That is a great time to check out the waterfalls because of the snow melt. So the volume and intensity of the falls is probably at its greatest.

This was our second time to visit the park. We have been in the summer but we wanted to see the park in the winter. It did not disappoint. There are still many trails for hiking/snowshoeing as well as wildlife to see. Trail ridge road is partially closed but it did not affect our visit at all. We stayed in Estes Park and the next time we will try out the Grand Lake side.

Always enjoy my time here. Bear lake is a good option for an easy hike. It’s paved, but you still feel like you got into the mountains. If you’re up for more, hike to nymph, dream and then emerald lake. It’s one of my favs. Another good one that is relatively easy with a big payoff is Alberta Falls.

I mean, it’s Rocky Mountain National Park my dudes. What can I say? Nothing. But I can type a bunch of words so that this counts as a detailed review. You feel me? This is probably enough words. ✌🏻✌🏻✌🏻✌🏻✌🏻

name: Laramie Railroad Depot
reviews: A key piece of Laramie history, the railroad depot is a gem. Built of locally quarried stone and little changed in more than a century, it is a popular site for weddings, parties, and other celebrations. Unfortunately, it's not in regular passenger service anymore, though vintage locomotives such as the UP 4014 Big Boy make the Laramie Depot an occasional stop.
Awesomely maintained historic building. Great for events. Large bathrooms and kitchen, tables chairs etc. Also has a lot of neat curated historic railroad displays. Many fun local events here

Historic, respo sibley for the founding of Laramie WY.   Small railroad museum and some historic cars. The snowplow train is massive. 

Over-track pedestrian bridge makes viewing much easier.

If you are an avid train enthusiast then look no further! The Laramie Railroad Depot has to of great history! There are lots of artifacts from the early days of the Union Pacific Railroad and the Laramie Hahn's Peak and Pacific Railroad. The museum is a great place to rent out for events and parties. I see something new every I stop in. Check it out!
Neat little spot of history tucked into downtown Laramie. It has a nice little play area and a train that you can look at any time of the day. It is also a great location for events and gatherings.

name: Boardwalk Park
reviews: We've always loved this park.  The kids love being able to rent the paddle boats and canoes. They ate very reasonable too. We've rented a covered shelter a few times and the only thing we're didn't like was there were people already using the space and we had to have them move.  I think it would have been easier to have a sign saying it would be reserved . But overall we really enjoy spending the day here.

Absolutely top tier. It's well maintained, I love the concerts they put on here. The area for swimming is a little small, but it's usually not too overwhelmed of people. They weren't various water crafts, in the sense of paddle boards and those water bicycles.The path around the lake is a very nice walk, and the views in every direction are scenic. Make a point of going here if you want to see something they are showing, because the stage is great.

Good place to take the kids
Hot spot for Pokemon Go fans (lots of stops)
And a beautiful paved path for hikers, joggers and bikers.
Love it here! Peaceful & calm, yet still alive and active. Clean beach, beautiful water, and a great place to be with friends and loved ones
Excellent place for a stroll... Especially early morning! 👍

name: Riverbend Ponds Natural Area
address: E Prospect Rd, Fort Collins, CO 80525, USA
reviews: Riverbend ponds is a great place to escape the city without leaving the city.. the trails are nice and wide although can be somewhat muddy in the winter time.. there are lots of birds that live in the marshy areas and I've even seen bald eagles there which is a wonderful site.. I love getting exercise walking all of the various trails and checking out the wildlife
Nice trails, so many options the parking lot can be full and you can still find some privacy. Good space with lots of ponds and lovely river views. Looks like a great option for in town fishing.

Good wildlife viewing and some ok fishing. Very nice place to walk with kids. It also had good south and east sky line so it's nice for watching sunrises and summer storms out on the plains. 
Downsides are messy fisherman (lots of line hooks and bait containers left about) and people who don't clean up after their dogs.
The best place to walk your doggie!  It is gorgeous winter, spring, summer, fall.  Lots of great bird-watching.

Beautiful place for a walk. In my opinion, one of Fort Collins better natural areas. In the summer you can see geese, ducks, blue heron,  pelicans, egrets and more. Beautiful also in the winter with snow on the ground.

name: Gateway Natural Area
reviews: Very pretty setting just a short drive from Fort Collins. Very nice park, facilities, natural setting. Ideal when "off peak" times to avoid weekenders and big buses of rafting companies. Winter and early / late hours are wonderful if you like Solitude, hiking or Fly Fishing the ice shelf. Great year round trout fishing on North Fork below Seaman's Reservoir and up / down the Poudre from Gateway. River can get a lot of pressure in the area, given quick access from town and high season. For more solitude and less people, keep climbing up the canyon (west) and Highway 14. There are plenty of places to go off the grid with short hike in access to some fantastic fly fishing.... camping, hiking, etc.
The fly fishing here is amazing one of the best spots in all of Colorado! If you are a beginner or an advanced fly fisherman and you have the chance definitely give this place a try!
Love this place. Beautiful with good facilities. Only downsides are that you can't camp overnight, and it's $7 for parking, which seems a little bit steep.
It's beautiful,  peaceful but stay on main road.  We took a path to the river for the dog to have a drink and encountered a rattler ready to strike.  I enjoy it more in the winter.  The dam is cool.
Another beautiful and relaxing place to visit.

name: Glenmere Park
reviews: It is a good park i enjoy walking around. Watch out for the geese. I have attached a picture of a goose. If you get near them they will hiss. They may look serene but they have the soul of the devil inside of them. Cool park though
One of the most beautiful spots in all of Northern Colorado. This park is well maintained and great for an evening walk.
Love this place close to home and great for my run.
Calm, scenic, geese arnt super hostile, and a fishing spot for all ages. Best visited in the evening with plenty of mosquito repellent.
I love this park. One of the best places to take pictures and can have a romantic outing. Great and beautiful place to hang out.

name: Bittersweet Park
reviews: I love this place. Good parking. And a great paved path around it that makes for about a 1 mile walk. Always nicely cleaned, and a great place to go! If you live in the area and want a good walk, this is the place!
Nice place to take your kids and exercise. Nothing like a day out at the park picnicking
Beautiful Park. The lake is beautiful and relaxing to sit by. The park has great amenities and it has a lot of offer. I love walking the path.
Great place for a nice walk and they are busy doing massive improvements to the park so this summer it will be even better!!
Love this park. Great playground for the kids. And a wonderful paved sidewalk all around the park & lake.

name: Our Lady of Peace Shrine
reviews:
A very peaceful place to visit for meditation, prayer, or to simply be reminded of history. 
A woman chosen to birth a very special child into the world.

A child chosen by the Father to show what true love is, through sacrifice.

A man who preached to all on how to live, how to forgive, how to rebuke, how to love.

Very Beautiful stations of the cross or the way of sorrow Everyone thinks it’s a Catholic thing. But Jesus Christ walked those steps for everyone one of us. Yes the high mass churches hold those stations in their hearts more than most because that’s the suffering Jesus Christ endured to give us salvation. I personally weep when I stop and give my thanks and reflect on the love he has for me. To whoever built this I give you thanks for such a beautiful peaceful place. And bringing the sacrifice and sorrow that Jesus Christ suffered so we may all may be forgiven and have everlasting life.

Not at all peaceful with I-80 just feet away and big rigs whizzing by. It should be named "Our Lady of All Things Loud Shrine" Putting trees up may help. Better yet, relocate it somewhere more quiet. 🚚🚛 ⛟ Its like having church in a bowling alley. 🎳🎳 Personally, I enjoyed the "Welcome To Nebraska" sign more.  Go Big Red !!!🏈🏈🏈
Wow,  what a place, great place to stop and say a prayer

Such a cool 15-20 minute detour getting there and back from the interstate. There is so much to look at besides Mother Mary, and has seating for Catholics or anyone who wants to comfortably kneel for a while and pray.

name: Nagle Warren Mansion B&B
reviews: Had a great tour of the mansion with Brandy before she showed us to our beautiful room. We enjoyed a glass of wine in the 3rd floor sitting room before dinner. Had the pleasure of having the owner Jim and his family join us for breakfast and enjoyed some additional history on the home and Cheyenne. We will definitely return!

The mansion is an excellent restoration of a Victorian mansion with many modern updates. It's beautiful inside. The attention to detail in what Jim and his team do is outstanding! I've never stayed at a cleaner accommodation. Nothing has been done 'on the cheap' at NWM. I guess I'll be looking for reasons to go to Cheyenne again so I can stay there.

The Mansion is closing down October 1st, 2019. I am so happy we were able to stay in this beautiful B&B and that we were able to attend the Christmas High Tea that was hosted here. Best wishes on your retirement Mr. Osterfoss and I loved staying at your beautiful home ❤
Such a beautiful Bed & Breakfast. Clean, great location, AMAZING staff. Jim & crew make you feel pampered. I cannot wait to go back!

Jim is a fantastic host. The service, staff and especially the breakfast is better than any five star hotel in a big city.  Worth the trip to Cheyenne all by itself. The mansion and the history is amazing.

name: Medicine Bow-Routt National Forest
reviews: The beauty of this place can't be explained in words.. My first 12k ft hike and it was strenous but the view from the top was completely worth it.. The biggest hurdle is unpredictable weather... I started the hike around 6 am and by 9 am there were clouds and scary ones... Always make sure you are prepared for the extreme swings... The drive to the lakes is also fun.. please try to find the historic crash wreckage if you are there.. :D

Love this National Forest! Lots of things to do and see. We went to Rocky Mountain National Park just after visiting here and agreed that we enjoyed medicine bow more. We visited in early July and though the main road was open and clear, most of the side roads like Mirror Lake were still deep in snow. There are many places to park and hike though. Beautiful alpine lakes!

It's simply one of the most beautiful mountain ranges I've ever seen.  The campgrounds are basic, no power, water or septic.  It keeps it very affordable. The camp host were we stayed was great, really nice and helpful. He even gave us a trail map to keep.

I can't believe the forest service! You've barely got your sleds unloaded and they're there looking for your state trails stickers, then you get up on the trail and its barely ridable, because it has'nt been groomed. Really disappointing!

Drive up here before the sunrise, you won't find a better view of South Eastern Wyoming in the morning! Once the sun is up you can continue further up the mountains shoulders, there are many places to pull over and picnic if you want. Not much else out this way, this is mountain country and mostly big ranch owned. Beautiful scenery though, a good photographer will have many chances at some very unique shots!

name: Arapahoe Bend Natural Area
reviews: I've taken dogs for walks here several times and it's a great easy trail with varying pathways. Horses are welcome here too! Great for someone looking to expose their animals to different traffic including bikes, hikers, runners and of course dogs. If you go all the way around the reservoir it turns into a pretty nice ride taking around an hour and a half at the walk.

There is a paved path and dirt. Port-a-potty in the middle. I usually see bald eagles here when I go. Sometimes they hang out by the cabin. The noise from the freeway can be quite loud and in summer it can be stinky but has a nice view and you can do a loop walk to get some mileage in.

Such a beautiful area.  Nice paved/dirt path around the reservoir.  Terrific view of the front range. 

The area is heavily posted with signs requiring dogs to be leashed and restricting access to the reservoir bank

Be prepared as many people will let their dogs run loose and attacks, bites often result.
Great place to walk dogs or take a short horseback ride! In the warmer months plenty of water fowl can be seen. Easy trails with pretty views despite being right in the city still.
I absolutely love this play. Easy access to several ponds, a beautiful nature trail, and best of all, the poudre river is right there

name: Red Rocks Park and Amphitheatre
address: 18300 W Alameda Pkwy, Morrison, CO 80465, USA
reviews:
It was great to finally visit this place and see why it's so popular. The red rock formations are a thing of beauty and makes any trip truly worth it. The geologically carved area that would become the amphitheater sits at a higher elevation so you get breathtaking views of the landscape, especially on a clear day. Downtown Denver's skyline is also visible in the distance, but you need binoculars or an advanced zoom camera to get a closer look. We'll definitely see a concert on our next visit.

We were here for a total of three hours. We started at the Red Rocks Trading Post at the base. Inside that building, we checked the gift shop and the Music Hall of Fame gallery, which features John Denver and many folk and jazz music greats. There are no admission fees there. We then walked uphill to the amphitheater, which took half an hour, with lots of picture taking stops along the way. We visited in the winter so the icy sections of the walk path also slowed us down. We took the same way going down, although there are other paths. If you don't prefer the hike, you can drive up to the top and park near the amphitheater.

Definitely a must see in Colorado! You can see most by driving through in your car so no excuses! Make sure to drive carefully there are sharp turns all around red rocks park. There are plenty of “little hikes” to take so pull off and park when you see signs for such. I like bringing friends to red rocks when they come to visit.

Absolutely worth a visit if you’re in the area.  Free admission (and parking) on quiet days (no shows scheduled) and there are plenty of trials to hike adjacent to the amphitheater. Visitors are free to roam the grounds — even walk on stage as long as you are mindful to follow the posted rules. I fully recommend a visit if you have time. Great for a quick workout, too! You could easily spend as little as 30 minutes or up to 2 hours here.

Aside from the most incredible concerts, Red Rocks also has hiking trails and incredible photo opportunities. If you are attending a concert for your first time I recommend getting there early to find parking in the lot and also wear comfortable shoes as it can be a climb to get up to the venue if you have to park on the road below. You will have an amazing time here!

This place is absolutely gorgeous. They have a small gift shop and history walk in the building at the top of the staircase. Visiting here not only gives you good exercise with all the stairs, but spectacular views of the mountain range. I would love to come to a concert here some point in the future!

name: Denver Botanic Gardens
reviews:
Whether in town for a couple days or a permanent resident of Denver, this is a MUST visit Denver attraction. The gardens are absolutely beautiful. They are open year round and every season brings something new. Additionally, they have great events ranging from music and concerts in the summer to their spring and fall markets to Blossoms of Light in the Winter. There really is something for everybody. Also, you can't go wrong grabbing a snack at their cafes.

The gardens offer a breath of fresh in the city. Its just another reason for you to spend more time outside.

This place is beautiful!!! I always get amazing photos! I have never had a bad experience here and I've been going here for as long as I can remember! This place has an amazing landscape. I would recommend if you love flowers! It is so peaceful here! You can just sit with nature and enjoy it all.

This is a very nice place to spend the day. There's so many beautiful plants and pools as well as some cool stuff for kids. I especially like the Japanese garden. It just was so peaceful. The Greenhouse area is also really cool. The plants in there are wild! Five stars!

We visited during the week and it was not crowded at all. We strolled and enjoyed taking our time. I imagine that it probably would be more lively during the spring and summer months, but we still thought most parts were beautiful. The gift shop had a wide selection of unique things, but I wish more items had “Denver Botanic Gardens” on them, so that I could have bought some souvenirs. I loved the painted canvas greeting cards, though. Overall, it was great and definitely worth the visit!

Came here after a work trip and loved it. It's a great place to sit and enjoy being outside to enjoy nature. There are several areas including a huge greenhouse and some water gardens.  The photos of this place do not do the beauty of the gardens justice.  They offer lunch there at the bistro and the food is very good.

name: Greeley History Museum
reviews: Great place to stop and get accurate, interesting history about Greeley and the surrounding communities. Their ever-changing exhibits keep things from becoming stale should you choose to return, and their gift shop has some WONDERFUL cookbooks that were derived from recipes local cultures have handed down over generations. Definitely recommend stopping in for a visit the next time you’re in Downtown Greeley.
Small, took about 45 minutes to get through the whole thing. We had time to kill so we walked slow. Inexpensive, it cost me and my three children $25
Very interesting. Very clean. Very informative.
Love the "Brown Bag" presentations.
Visited the place where I used to fold papers before delivering them. Memory Lane.

name: Fort Laramie Visitor Center
address: 965 Grey Rocks Road, Fort Laramie, WY 82212, USA
reviews:
Awesome experience. My wife and I traveled short distance from Scottsbluff. Beautiful clear November day the young lady at the visitor center was so friendly! All the staff was, and they played the video for us even though no other visitors were there at the time. They made us feel so special like we were honored guests. 
It was such a special day.
Ranger Joe is great,  funny and knowledgeable  about the fort and it's history. We will definitely be back.

Great historical site with lots of restored buildings and originals as well, free admission and plenty of parking. The video in the visitor center was very helpful, but it would have been nice to get more of the native history as well. Dogs are allowed on the grounds and the trails, but not inside the buildings (which makes sense). It's nice that they are accommodating though, even going as far as having some dog watering stations. Definitely worth a detour if you want to jump into some US History
Ranger Joe is great,funny and very knowledgeable about fort Laramie will definitely go back
Come visit history.  Really cool

name: Scotts Bluff National Monument
address: 190276 Old Oregon Trail, Gering, NE 69341, USA
reviews: I'm all about nature, so I was thrilled to finally visit. The Ranger station is full of interesting facts about the Bluffs and surrounding area. Our granddaughter, 8 yrs, was enthralled by the vistas and all the trails that she could walk. She even wanted to walk the trail from the top down to the Ranger station.  A great follow on to the Chimney Rock visit.

This National Monument was beautiful! We stopped here on a mini road trip from Colorado to South Dakota. We saw the monument on the map and made it a rest stop / activity mid-way. We were able to hike two trails at the top of the monument and the view was incredible!  The staff was super friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful. The area was undergoing some renovations, but it did not interfere with our experience here at all. We loved it and highly recommend it!

Excellent little stopover with stunning views of the surrounding areas if you drive to the top. Want to stretch your legs? Hike up from the visitor center on the Saddlerock trail for about 3 total miles. It's mostly paved, and you'll get into some views you can't get driving up.

We're full time RVr's focused on hiking. Blog link in my bio.

This area of the country is beautiful with so much history. The NM is very well maintained and everything is easy to get to. The drive up Mitchell pass is a must as well as the short trek up and down Saddle Rock Trail, just make sure you take plenty of water! The scenes from the top of the bluffs is beautiful and you can see the whole town and valley below. The visitors center was closed when we visited but I'm sure it has a lot of great information.
Such a Beautiful place! My wife and I spent time and hiked with our oldest daughter here on the 2nd of Feb. and it was around 70 and sunny! A great God blessed day here together and so much fun!

name: Snowy Range Ski Area
reviews: Class act all the way! Great for individuals and large groups. I would totally feel safe sending my 12 year old on a group trip here. The owners Aaron and Becky have done an amazing job making cool changes the last few years!! Big enough for a great ski, small enough for a good time. Ski school is affordable and we'll worth it!

Had another fantastic day at Snowy Range! Fresh powder, great runs, friendly staff, short lines, very reasonable prices - it just doesn't get any better than this! Each of the instructors me/my kids have taken lessons with have been top notch - thank you Paul, Steve and Flash! Absolutely worthwhile to take a lesson each day, you learn something each time, try more runs, and meet new people. Great variety of runs and plenty for beginners/intermediate who don't like the steep slopes of Colorado and just want to have fun. This will be my forever skiing "home"!

Super cold! And so windy that I was getting blown backwards on a couple of the greens. If the conditions were a little bit better, with a little more fresh snow covering the ice, would have been perfect. Oh and the girl at the counter was friendlier than most resorts I've been through out here.

Snowy Range Ski Area is a hidden gem! Its not too packed, the snow fall is great and the instructors are Top Notch. It just needs a bit better food situation for the lodge and it would be a perfect 5 stars.

If you have kiddos and need lessons, ask for Jacob H. HE IS AMAZING at instructing the little ones in snowboarding!! We will return quite a bit because of him.

Snowy Range is a pretty small local hill with something for everyone. The lines are generally pretty quick if there are any at all. I hit on an awesome powder day and the entire mountain was open. If you can make it to Corner Mountain, do so. Different terrain and usually not as windy.
The bar has some good locally brewed beers and the food is worth a try.

name: Bee Family Centennial Farm Msm
address: 4320 E Co Rd 58, Fort Collins, CO 80524, USA
reviews: Very nice farm, the tour gives some insights of the American life from before 100 years ago. Owners are extremely nice and helpful.

I bought a groupon for our family.   We took 5 children ages 4 to 8 and three adults. We went on Saturday afternoon this also happened to be their Pioneer weekend. Leanne was our guide.  The kids wanted to see the animals. Leanne took us to see the cows,  chickens,  turkeys,  a sheep and pig. She was very interactive with the children asking questions and explaining different animal facts. We toured the original home and then the family home from 1942. There also was a woman spinning sheep fleece to make yarn. Mr. Rick took us on a wagon ride called the trolly and explained farming. This is a great family activity.  The Bee Family members were wonderful tour guides.  We will return again next spring to see the new farm animal babies.
We had a blast as a family visiting this farm and checking out all it had to offer!
A lot of history, great place to go with family.

We went today and enjoyed this farm museum SO much!  Rich was so personable and funny, a very warm hearted man.  They have SO much interesting relics and information on the history of farming in Colorado.  We all thought it was well worth the trip, and I believe younger children would REALLY enjoy it, as they have fun activities set up for them.  :)

name: Denver Zoo
reviews:
Great way to learn and spend a day with family! I love that they are always working to expand and make the exhibits for the animals better. My favorite exhibit is the monkeys. I like that they have real trees to climb and can go inside and out freely. 
The food is good there as well! I would recommend the Pineapple Dole Whip, it is just like ice cream but much healthier.

The animals are easy to see with the well designed exhibits. Bring an umbrella on a hot day for shade; there are some long stretches of parts without shade. 
The zoo does a lot of animal encounters and educational shows/activities throughout the day! So fun!
Food and drink are pricey but you can bring in your own meals.

We just got a membership, and although I’d love to give 5 stars, the limited accessibility of the zoo makes it hard for me to enjoy it fully. There are several bathrooms without automated door buttons and several exhibits I could not enjoy because of my wheelchair. My kids and husband had a wonderful time, and I did too, but I can’t give it a better rating than three stars. The paths are very uneven and it’s incredibly difficult to wheel around. I would have rented a scooter but they charge $30/day!

As an Aurora Native, I have been visiting the Zoo all my life. As far as the dozen or so Zoo's I have visited, it is pretty good. They are always making improvements. My favorite attraction is Tropical Discovery (I could watch the bats all day!). The Zoo is building new attractions currently and I look forward to seeing the new Stingray exhibit. The giraffes, the primates and the pachyderms are also nicely developed. Well informed and very welcoming staff too. 🐠🦅🐧🦘🦇🐘🐫🦓🐅🐒🦏🐾🌲🌳

Great zoo. Not too big but packs a punch delivering plenty of very interesting things to see. Great place to go for an afternoon stroll and ask questions to the volunteer staff. Would absolutely recommend for children and adults alike. They also have free days so keep an eye out for them.

name: Guernsey Ruts
reviews: Gorgeous view and a really nice kept trail! Definitely worth a drive to go see the massive ruts that the wagons made so many years ago.
Very historic and interesting. It sounds boring but it's not. Great walking path. Only wish I'd stopped at name rock.
Well kept. You can feel the history here.

Amazing how wagons could carve ruts this deep into rock. The people traveling the Oregon Trail were definitely tougher than most people today! A must see, and read all the Interpretive signs to learn more about the amazing travels. I also recommend touring Fort Peck and Register Cliffs while you're in the area.

This is a peaceful tranquil place to visit. Located near the North Platte River in Guernsey Wyoming. I recommend doing a little bit of research on the area as there are many historical sites to visit such as Fort Laramie which had a trading post, Telegraph office, it was a pony express stop and a major stop along the way 4 people heading to California in search of gold. It is part of the Mormon trail for people heading to Salt Lake City and it also part of the Oregon Trail 4 people heading up to the northwest. Originally part of Spain and then France held it and eventually sold it as part of the Louisiana Purchase.

name: Denver Art Museum
address: 100 W 14th Ave Pkwy, Denver, CO 80204, USA
reviews:
Purchased our VIP Hotel package for the Monet exhibit which was amazing!!! We flew in from Idaho on Th and spent all day there Friday, Jan. 31, 2020. We had "dinner" at their snack bar, salad, sandwich and drink and stayed for their QUARTERLY Friday night party, with a DJ, art trivia, a glass of wine,  and another exhibit on the third floor featuring light "Entanglement".  This was a most creative exhibit.
The other building was closed for renovation until 2021, so access to their great restaurant and permanent exhibits were not available. But, we so enjoyed our main focus: the Monet exhibit. I rate it a 10. Even the building is art.  Great work Denver Art Museum staff, organizers, docents, and volunteers!!! Will return again.

This museum was very interesting. The attractions were creative to say the very least. The exhibits were all unique. There is a mirror exhibit that visitors can physically enter and see themselves reflected dozens of times over. A real play on vision. The design of the building itself is breath taking, from the inside of the building, top of the stairs...take a look down, the architecture is a work of art. This is worth the visit.

A great collection of pieces with variety, artfully grouped in themes and sub-themes. Interactive portions were plentiful and engaging. I appreciate the opportunity to come and soak in inspiration, and then be asked to create something for myself. I'm glad we allocated most of our day to our visit, and that the pass is good all day so that we could take a break for lunch and return refreshed.

I LOVE THIS PLACE! I’m actually pretty sure I’m going to do everything in my power to come back in May for the George Orwell installation! Great place to visit with or without kids! 

So many beautiful works of art of every type of medium! I also loved how they really used all of the space available to them for art work. We didn’t get to go to the sculpture garden because it was snowing but I can only imagine. We went during the week and did not have any problem with a crowd - there were even a few school groups there but they were the best behaved I’ve ever seen (good job teachers!) 

I can’t wait to become a member here (: there gift shop also has a lot of neat things to offer!

We are so lucky to have such an amazing museum here in Denver! They get some of the best exhibits in the country which people from all over come to see. The permeates collections are great too. I also like that the museum is kid friendly. I’ve been bring my nieces since they were quite young and because of their experiences here have found a love for art. Thanks DAM!!!

name: Harmony Park
address: 5015 Corbett Dr, Fort Collins, CO 80528, USA
reviews: Clean, quiet park with a solid playground. It also has a plumbed restroom, drinking fountain, and a small covered picnic area. My son loves climbing on the boulders placed around the park.
Lovely little, long, skinny park, nice play area, nice restrooms, nice playing fields, all well maintained
Very pretty park! Not as many things to do, but very peaceful and in a nice neighborhood.
It's a very nice park.
Perfect place to take the kids. Swings, restrooms, slides, rocks to climb, picnic tables, large fields, and a little playhouse unde

name: Global Village Museum of Arts
address: 200 W Mountain Ave # C, Fort Collins, CO 80521, USA
reviews: Great place to spend the afternoon.   Great displays of different cultures.  You can take your time going through and get up close and personal with the exhibits.  Friendly and informative staff.
Very interesting art but very small for the admission.
Had a wonderful visit here with my son when he had a cultural project to do and they had an exhibit of Russian art!
A terrific gem of a museum.  Fort Collins is lucky to have!
Excellent museum for a great price, $5 adult,  $1 kid. Small and full of interesting exhibits for adults and kids. Right in Old Town.

name: Butterfly Pavilion
reviews: Great learning experience for adults and kids alike. We got a pass connected with the children’s museum for my son. The play area is good but it is difficult to see your child when they are up in the ‘tree house’ part. We enjoyed looking at the marine and bug exhibits as well as walking in the butterfly area.

First time back to the Butterfly Pavilion since 1998 (i was 5 at the time I went, now 26) and I had an absolutely wonderful time!!! My boyfriend and I went just kinda willy nilly and really enjoyed learning things we didn’t know!!! Rosie the tarantula was very cool and really quite sweet! I didn’t think I would ever hold a spider but, Alex made me feel much more comfortable facing my fears! Alex was incredible and very knowledgeable! I enjoyed my time so much and found it very therapeutic, I ended up getting a Membership! Will definitely be going back later this week! A must do if you live in Denver!!!

This place is awesome. I'm a Florida native and I know invertebrates but man oh man the staff there is absolutely nothing short of astonishing with their knowledge and happy to share. I got lots of photos and if you want to see lots of butterflies flying around I reccomend going towards closing time. They all fly around at high speed to find the best sleeping spots! Just watch your step and be gentle if they land on you!
The staff is wonderful! Very knowledgeable and kind. My daughter had tons of questions and they were more than happy to answer all of them.
First time going today. I was really looking forward to it because I had heard it was a nice place. Disappointing. 3 rooms with not much to see for $27. Go to the zoo instead.

name: Wings Over the Rockies Air & Space Museum
address: 7711 E Academy Blvd, Denver, CO 80230, USA
reviews: What a unique and interesting place to go visit! It's an amazing experience to be so close to the actual planes. Just the amount of history in one building is amazing. They do a great job explaining the types of airplanes and what they were built for. May not hold the interest of smaller children, but they do a good job of keeping things there for all ages.
We had several companies celebrating here. Was wonderful, fun and interesting. Excellent space for such. However would also recommend for family or school outing visit.

As you can see my husband enjoyed himself here. I think anyone who, as a as a child dreamed of flying planes are going into space, would enjoy themselves here. My only complaint would be that they need to do more interactive programs with the aircraft. But definitely a great way to spend a few hours.

This may be a super cool place if you have a love for aviation. I have been spoiled with seeing many museums over the years. If you have visited the Air & Space in DC or the Air and Space Annex in the DC area this will be a huge disappointment.  If you have not experienced any similar ones, then this would be a good first one to see.
I took my son and we spent three wonderful hour here. Very interesting and educational place. Would definitely recommend visiting!

name: Boot Barn
reviews: This is the place for all things western. Knowledgeable associates ready to guide you through every item.  We both got great fitting Wrangler jeans.

My son purchased boots for our two year old granddaughter but they were too small. We exchanged them with no hassle. We got great customer service and the boot, hat and Western wear selection is phenomenal here.

Not sure why Google still calls it the Boot Barn as the only signage now is Wrangler.  My lovely lady found a pair of boots she loved so we dropped a little coin here. I found the prices of the 'other' stuff really high so I could not give five stars.  But the boot selection was outstanding and the prices on those seemed reasonable.
Great store. They’ve got everything.

Location location location. The 3 most important words in Real Estate. This place is located in the heart 💖💖 of Cowboy Country off the old Lincoln Highway. What could possibly be better ??? Well, for one, Carrie Underwood taking me on a shopping spree there would be a step in the right direction. Giddy-Up 🤠🤠🤠

name: Medicine Bow-Routt National Forests
reviews: Camped up by Dunckley Pass. The Flat Tops are incredibly scenic! Unique topography of the flat topped alpine mountains with jagged cliffs on the sides. So glad it's a protected wilderness area. Wait until after Aug 1st to visit. There are dozens of lakes, with lots of mosquitos in June and July.

We went there for snow Buddies Dog Sledding it was an outstanding experience that we even got to have time with the dogs and help them set up and drive the sleds. It is a little bit out of the way but I highly recommend it.
This is the Backcountry you need to see on skis or in the summer. Such surreal natural wildlife and settings. Views that can only be compared to true mountain tops.

One of the prettiest parks in all of Colorado. Been coming up here for the last 25 years and still enjoy it like it's the first time.  I highly recommend any part of the park for camping fishing hiking and relaxation!

This national Forest exceeded our expectations!! The views were great. Weather was lovely. And there were very few mosquitoes. Visited in early July and the main road was open but pretty much all side roads were still covered in snow.

name: Greeley Poudre River Trails
address: Vern Schafer Blvd, Greeley, CO 80631, USA
reviews: Rode my bike the whole trail while overdosed on mucinex and dehydrated to getting some cool pics. The trail is pretty cool a lot of nice boomers on the trail but I love the route

My wife, son, and I took a two mile stroll along this trail on a cool winter day. Even in the winter, there is an abundance of birds: geese, ducks, hawks and small birds. The trail is wide and paved. The river runs adjacent to a gravel pit as you leave the Park's boundry, so expect that, but we enjoyed the river and beautiful views of the Colorado Rockies.

what an amazing trail. This is an easy 21 mile paved and mostly flat trail that goes to/from Greeley to/from Windsor with plenty of stops in between. A portion of this trail is within the city but the majority is out in the country and you are surrounded by beautiful views of mountains, open fields, lakes, trees and farmland and all that you can hear is the wind rustling through the trees and maybe a small critter jumping into the water. I would say the best time to go is in the spring or fall when the air is cool and crisp, or in the early morning hours of the summer.
As I am Indian and I was here first time. This is one of the best trail. I was here on Sunday evening and hardly rush over here. Really nice. Highly recommended.
One of my most favorite trails. Never too busy for biking, rollerblading or running.

name: Glendo State Park
address: 397 Glendo Park Rd, Glendo, WY 82213, USA
reviews: Very quiet and pleasant. Very limited electric hookups. Several campgrounds, many sites with view of the reservoir. We dry camped for $25 (non-resident 😢) for 1 night in our motorhome. This fee seems quite steep for dry camping. Great site in Whiskey Gulch campground. We were down near the water. Ridge top sites could be quite windy.
Love being here!

Amazing and great people. They helped my family member when he was hurt along with warning us about the weather, one man seemed off duty but still went around warning people about a tornado that might hit out area and what to do.
Beautiful
Good fishing

name: Poor Richard's Restaurant
reviews: Been in town plenty times and haven’t tried this place until now. Lots of great reviews especially on the service. It was not a let down at all. The outside doesn’t at all do the inside justice. Lots of pretty woodwork and decor. Walking in there's a decked out vintage looking bar and dim lit tables with cushioned chairs. On the other side there’s rows of intimate tables and booths. Menu is full of plenty of dishes to satisfy any kind of inkling. Service was pleasant and attentive. Large parking lot as well which filled up very fast at lunch time.

Highly recommend. Been there twice now and the food is always amazing. Their cranberry marg is my favorite thing on the menu by far. The service is incredible! We will continue to come back when we're in the mood for some great food.
Prime rib was great! Service was friendly and attentive. Bathrooms were clean. Great place to have dinner.

Okay, so I put T-Joes steak as the best in town, but Poor Richards is right there. A little more expensive, but better tasting in some ways. The quality of the meat I can taste is so much better here! They also have the best steak I have ever had. It's better in it's own ways. I had the top sirloin with brandied mushrooms and it melted in my mouth. I'm full but drooling thinking about it. Haha. The staff was nice, I wouldn't say they were super or went above and beyond by any means, but they were nice. Highly recommend 9/10

Food was mediocre at best and pricess were high.  Update:. I am basing this review off my only visit there which was in October 2019.  Apparently if you leave a bad review here the owner or manager/employee will find you on facebook and send you messages from a fake Facebook account.

name: Anong's | Thai Cuisine
reviews: For Thai food in Wyoming, this is very good. Order extra spicy, 4-5, if you really like spicy. Tofu was a little chewy. Atmosphere was clean and cozy. Very cool decor.
Hidden gem.Loved the ambience and decor. The service was really nice. All the dishes were spot on except the complimentary soup which was bland. Best Thai in Cheyenne.
This place is wonderful!! I am hooked on their Pad Thai with Beef. The flavors are amazing. I highly recommend Anong's if you want the best Thai food in Cheyenne!!!
I'm over 800 miles from home and this little gem in a small town is a wonderful find. Food has been authentic and very very good every time we've came. Would highly recommend the Tomka Soup.
I have never had thai food until now. This place rocks. The food was so good. The soup they give you to start off with is delicious!!!! Also I hope to try it again.

name: Guadalajara Mexican Restaurant Cheyenne
address: 1745 Dell Range Blvd, Cheyenne, WY 82009, USA
reviews: Great food and atmosphere. Very colorful furniture. The seafood burrito is my go to dish. Had a good amount of sauce. Service is great.
Food was amazing!!! Burrito Loco, so so good.  Very flavorful. My waiter was very nice and always checking on me.  His recommendation of the burrito was spot on.

Ordered at 6 pm through door dash. Called restaurant at 8 pm and they said they never received our order. Funny thing is door dash charged us $80.00 for the order we never got. Thank you Guadalajara for not making our food. Lost a great customer.
Best Mexican food in town! Family has been going here since I was a kid. Food is great, people are great! Love this place
Wow! Excellent, fast service. Perfect food: temp, taste, presentation. My new favorite.

name: Texas Roadhouse
address: 1931 Blue Grass Cir, Cheyenne, WY 82009, USA
reviews: You can’t go wrong. Only once have I had an over cooked steak here and they replaced it with no questions asked. Even let me take the other one home for my dog

This place has the happiest employees which carries over to how their guests are treated!  The food is always amazing and they have done a great job adapting to social distancing.  I recommend this place for a first date all the way to date night away from the kids. Or bring the kids for family fun (you know, when they open again)

We were ready to wait 35-40 minutes for a table and were surprised when it only took 10 minutes. Our waitress was Cassy and she was pretty good.
