Kept drinks full and asked a few times if everything was all right. My potato soup was forgotten and I said don't worry about it as my entree was already there. Cassy came a few minutes later with my soup ready to go in take home containers with the condiments in a separate bag on the side. That was great! Food tasted delicious from the peanuts, the fresh dinner rolls, tender steaks and the honey mustard. YUM!

We went there tonight for dinner and Justin was our server! Oh my gosh this guy ROCKS! He was polite, funny, dedicated and friendly! Absolutely the very best experience we have ever had there and we have NEVER had a bad experience! Justin just went way above and beyond! The food was perfection! It was a best night! Thank you so much!!!

Texas Roadhouse, I've been eating at them around the country for many years and I can honestly say, I've never been disappointed!
No matter what day, what location they are consistently the absolute best steak and family restaurants around!
If you can't get a good steak here then you are way to finicky..
Give them a try, I guarantee you won't be disappointed!

The service and atmosphere is fantastic..

name: L'Osteria Mondello
address: 1507 Stillwater Ave ste d, Cheyenne, WY 82009, USA
reviews: Best pizza in Cheyenne. Moved here recently and after touring the city and pizza this is the best. If you love thin crust NY Style pizza. Prices are reasonable. Best thing to order is cheese or pepperoni (and from other places we order supreme) but the simple pizza is the best here. Too many toppings make a soggy crust.

We stopped in for the deluxe pizza it was awesome! Best pizza in town. The service was superb👌 Friendly staff
Will definitely come back!
i love that this place is family owned by Italians! they’re all hilarious and give great customer service! the pizza rolls are my favorite, stuffed with mozzarella and pepperoni. ugh so delicious!

I’ve been going to mondelo's since I was a little kid. We’ve always had amazing service from joe the owner, and the pizza has always been some of the best pizza in town! I will continue to go here now as an adult!

L'Osteria Mondello, Small World. I used to work here. That was close to 2 years ago. It's hard to describe the sensation of working in a place like this. It's small and busy but genuine. It's like the difference between a good suit and a cheap suit.
I started out here as a dishwasher. I would work here for reasonable hours and reasonable pay but the thing I will always remember is the people. Joe and Cesare, Chanrda Moore, Ashley- The pizzeria was a bustling plethora of soul. 
I had solved so many problems here and caused some by accident. I have made the pizzas. I have cleaned the freezers. I have seen the heart of L'Osterio Mondello and sometimes the pressure can be a bit too much for folks but there Is  a flaming, beating heart to be found here.
The pizza is solid. Definitely a cut above other chain brands. When there is enough staff? The restaurant Sings like the hills of Arcadia. It's vibrant, rich like song. Sure the place has had some water problems and as someone who had to clean out the occasional Wasp Nest, I can speak with certainty that Joe Mondello, "Iron Joe" as I used to call him, is going to run his restaurant for the rest of his life or die trying. That's how you know it's authentic.
I cannot recommend Mondello's enough to casual people. Come in. Experience the truth and all that soft gospel. Only one pizza place exactly like it in Cheyenne for all it's worth.
Until I find a better, actual sit down pizza joint, Mondellos will always stand out in my mind as the genuine article.

name: Bella Fuoco Wood Fired Pizza
reviews:
The best place to eat in Cheyenne -- no question. Great food, great service, and great people.

I've read a couple other reviews and, yes, it gets crowded, especially in the summer. But it's deserved, and they always deliver friendly service and great pizza.

Amazing.  I enjoyed the friendly staff members.  Fantastic  service and  I loved  my Jalapeno popper pizza with chicken and bacon.  The sweet  chili sauce was  splendid to top it off.  William  our waiter  was fantastic. Will be back  real soon.👍👌

Great food. Sometimes good service. But multiple times now we have been told we had a table reserved only to have another employee refuse to seat us when we got there and given other guests preference over us. It's a popular place, but it seems they do not value having the professionalism to maintain reservations. And they pick and choose who they will give tables to. Tonight isn't the first time we have walked out because of this they 
will continue to lose valuable customers if they treat people this way.
Great selection of food. Atmosphere was good. Everything was well organised. Staff were nice.

Pretty good pizza.  It has a decent menu with some creative pizza options as well a make your own option.  The crust is the centerpiece here, it is so delicious. Gluten free options are on the list along with a selection of craft beers and a soda fountain and selected bottles sodas.

name: The Albany
reviews: The Albany restaurant has always been one of the better, non-chain restaurants in Cheyenne. It has been around for many decades, so that should be a good indication it's high quality food and great atmosphere. I would like to give it another half star, but this system wouldn't let me do that. The majority of the dining area is polished wood booths, with a few tables in the back for groups larger than 4. It fits right in with the downtown area, having vintage pictures up so you can see a glimpse of what Cheyenne used to be like. All-in-all, a very good place to eat!

Hadn't been here in a couple years as we live an hour south. Came here tonite as they closed dine in restaurants in Colorado. The service and food was really great. My prime rib was the best I've had in a long time. My wife's sirloin was excellent too.
Excellent comfort food served in a unassuming but comfortable dining room. This place has been in business a while and I can understand why.

Delicious food in a great atmosphere. The Albany has been here a long time, and it seems to be a great place to taste some of Cheyenne. There's a liquor store ingrained next to it if you're into that. Prices for the restaurant were reasonable and I would not mind stopping here again.

Our food was excellent.  We had quick service from hostess, bartender and waitress. Reasonable prices on all items. Order drinks at their bar while we waited for our table. As soon as we were seated we were greeted by a friendly and courteous waitress.  We ordered water and appetizer of bull nuts.  They were not overcooked and came promptly.   My salad was fresh and the homemade salad dressing was delicious.   Their house favorite, the open prime rib sandwich was delicious and tender.  Their chile Rellenos were also good.   It was the annual Frontier Days so lots of people but still had great service and fresh food.

name: Sanford's Grub & Pub
reviews: This will likely be the only meal I ever eat in the great state of Wyoming, and it was absolutely worth the drive. The ribs were phenomenal, the fried bread and butter was phenomenal, the beans were delicious, and the beers nice and cold. The menu selections were frankly not what I'd expect for the area, but that's no complaint - the Cajun cuisine plays well everywhere. Service was top notch. Sanford's was the first result when I googled "best restaurant in Cheyenne" and while it's also the only restaurant in Cheyenne I will likely ever try, it's clear to this long time traveler that this would be the best restaurant in many cities in the US.

Sanford's is a definite must if you are in the Cheyenne Wyoming area. The food is amazing and their portions are HUGE.

I had the Garlic Mushroom Steak with shrimp Gumbo and parmesan fries. So good and the service was top notch. Josh our bartender made sure that our visit was fun and memorable.

Good food, large portions and all kinds of crazy sandwiches , burgers and salads and more. Endless fries. Huge menu. Reasonably priced. A good place to meet up with friends or family in a relaxed atmosphere. They serve alcohol. Friendly staff. Located in old downtown Cheyenne.  Free street parking. Military discounts!

This place is an outstanding eatery!! Recommended by our hotel, we stopped in for lunch. This was my favorite restaurant on our week long trip. Food and service is top notch. Hope to come back one day when in the area!
Very cool place for a family. Lots of food!  Everything we had was very good. You’ll definitely have leftovers.

name: Hacienda Guadalajara Cheyenne
reviews: My daughter took me to supper for my birthday.  I love the bacon wrapped shrimp.  It was so good!  Before we settled in our chairs, we were served fresh chips and salsa and they were really good!  The employees are really kind and attentive and get you anything you need.  Best Mexican food in town!

Great food and great service always. 
The waiters make you feel special yet they are always busy. 
The restaurant always has a lot of guests. 
I enjoy the seafood burrito and my husband also has it now too.
Very tasty.

This is an Americanized Mexican menu. So, I only gave 4 stars. They did tame down the entry level flavors. That was a recommended improvement from 2 years ago. My previous review was 3 stars. Our server was very polite and kind. The server paid adequate attention to our dining needs. Our table area was clean. Prices were reasonable.  Overall, the food was at a good temp. One of our entrees had freezer burned shrimp, so I just could not give 5 stars. All diners at our table enjoyed their meals.
This is one of my favorite places to go eat out. The staff is super nice no matter how busy they are. Food is delicious.
Best Mexican cuisine in town! I love taking my wife here for dinner dates and you get tons of food for the price

name: Grandpa's Downtown Pizzeria
reviews: The pizza was phenomenal! I was totally surprised by how great the pies were. I admit I "judged the book by its cover" when I went in. It just looks like another pizza place. but, you can taste the love they hand toss into the dough and in the selection of unique toppings. A sausage pizza there is not just another sausage pizza!
This place is Amazing for a quick bite to Eat! The pizza is delicious. Very affordable. I Recommend you stop in and say hi to Grandpa.

The pizza was soooo good! Get the special Grandpa's Pizza for sure, but all the pizza were awesome. The garlic Knots are amazing too. Best I've ever had! And while we didn't try any of the other food, some people at the table next to us were raving about the sandwiches as well. I highly recommend it! Great place with great food!
Such a great pizza place. And very delicious
Tried my first pizza from Grandpa's and it was delicious. If you love a New York pie, it is must stop. Will recommend to everyone.

name: Bejo Sushi and Asian Cuisine
reviews: Awesome staff. Extremely nice staff.  The best food around by a long shot.

Hello when I went into this place I thought it was really nice, was greeted quickly, sat down quickly. I know there are options of 12 and under menu but I had my mom, a senior.  She doesn't care much for sushi or Asian food and wasn't very hungry, it was late. On their 12 and under menu my mom wanted Fried Chicken,  they wouldn't let her order it. I didn't understand why we were told no. We did have a child with us as well. We tried to order both for "her" but still no. Finally, a manager made an exception, all seemed annoyed. I was not impressed with the entree, the sushi was okay. Pricey. I won't be back. I know, rules are rules.
Hot and Sour soup is my favorite! Attentive staff and great food. Every time I'm in town I make it a point to eat here. I've never once been disappointed, I wish they had one near me in Michigan. :)
Fantastic food.  Absolutely delicious massaman curry and prawn teriyaki.  Weirdly disinterested waiters, not keen on communicating.

The sushi rolls were excellent. My wife loved the sweet and sour chicken. Service was fast and great. The general environment was pleasing as well. You get your money's worth here. I'd definitely recommend and come back when I crave sushi.

name: R&B Breakfast Club
reviews:
Though I don't come here often, my family love to come here for breakfast. Their breakfast burrito is excellent, and I always leave filled. My teenage sons love coming when they have the all you can eat breakfast burrito, so they can stuff themselves and see who can eat the most.
It is also fun to sit and look at all the Elvis pictures and collectables. The service is good and friendly.
Awesome breakfast burritos small town environment.  A great place to meet up with friends or coworkers.
Amazing breakfast burritos and burgers! Service is awesome.  Thank you Tish and Karna!
One of  the best places  to eat, ,but because they are always  busy  you  will have wait, but is worth  the wait.. remember  you can call for order  to go. But have to eat it at home.

The breakfast burritos are very good. Green chilli tastes great on them. My kids enjoy the Mickey pancake. There is generally always a wait. Phones stay busy with to go orders. I dont like how rushed you feel while here. Small establishment for how busy it gets for breakfast. Small parking lot.

name: AB BBQ
address: 1503 W College Dr, Cheyenne, WY 82007, USA
reviews:
Just passing through Cheyenne WY. Asked were the best BBQ was and several people said AB BBQ. A small place in AB Campground with a limited season (April-October)  and hours, 4 - 8 pm. 
Ordered 2 of the 1/2 rack baby back rib dinners with a side of pulled pork and brisket.  Some of the best BBQ I have had in a while. If happen to be hungry and the dates and time fit your schedule, you got to try this place out.

My friends and I were heading up to Wyoming to go fishing for the weekend. We were passing through Cheyenne around dinner time and wanted to get some good food but, Cheyenne is not really known for that.  One of my friends found this place online and convinced us to try it out. It was only about a minute or two off of I 25.   The food was tremendous. The ribs were the best thing but I suggest any of it.  Also, the people working there were hilarious and very fun to be around.   They even let us bring our own beers in there .  I highly recommend this place. Way better than any BS chain restaurants

Very delicious! Potato salad was very good, the corn was as well. They need knifes on the tables to spread butter. The bbq sauce was spot on and the meat (I had the brisket) was juicy, and flavorful. I wish they had given me a bun instead of a roll though. I give It a solid 4.

I love local restaurants.  AB BBQ does not disappoint at being a restaurant that has an amazing menu.

Why only four stars?  I want to give that last star, but the sauce, the sauce just leaves something to be desired.  It's almost too tomato-y?    

We ended up just getting the meat itself, so a half point of pork and a half pound of brisket.  The meat was amazing, no fat, falling apart on the fork.  The staff was super busy (they were taking care of both the camp ground and the restaurant) but they managed to get us what we wanted fairly fast.  

I plan on going to this BBQ restaurant in the future
Possibly the best barbeque I've had at a great price.  Bring family and friends . Your friends and family will thank you.

name: Korean House Restaurant
reviews: Always consistently great quality, reasonable prices. Flawless customer service, down to earth and friendly staff. Everything feels very clean and welcoming. This is a small local business I love to support and would recommend to absolutely everyone!!!
Delicious!! Friendly staff and delicious food. Bring cash.
The food was unique and delicious. The people were so sweet! Not much of a wait for the quality of food. I can't wait to go back next time I'm in town.

I had bulgogi at another restaurant in Fort Collins and I had a hankering, so I tried this place to fill the void. It wasn't bad by any means, but it definitely left me wanting for the bulgogi from the other place. The restaurant itself is odd and kind of run down looking. If you eat your food there they serve you on paper plates. They also only take cash which is pretty inconvenient. Maybe it's just me and I'm wrong, but as far as I know, most people these days only use cards for payments. I might be able to be convinced to go back if somebody I'm with wants to go, but otherwise I will head to Fort Collins if I have another bulgogi hankering.

KIM WHIPS IT UP IN DA KITCHEN. Everything be too fuego🔥🔥🔥 it’s always cooked to perfection. It’s pretty small inside but it’s so delicious. The beef bulgogi SLAPS💥 the Korean rice cakes SLAP💥 the kimchi SLAPS 💥 bi bim bop goes HARRRRDDDDD. Love the food here it’s definitely super authentic and fresh there’s NO other place like it in Cheyenne.

name: 2 Doors Down
reviews: What a great and unexpected find for lunch while passing through Cheyenne. Unfortunately we couldn't sit down because of COVID but the staff were so nice, welcoming, and accommodating, even bringing out the food to our car. The burgers were excellent, the meat was nicely seasoned, and the veggies were fresh. Thank you so much to the lovely staff of two doors down for making our stop so great. Definitely would recommend to anyone while in Cheyenne, Wyoming.

Food is always very good. Price is right and the service makes you feel as if you just stepped into your own mom's kitchen. During the Covid 19 crisis, 2 doors down delivered. They didn't lay anyone off, and their service was unwavering. 10/10 the best burger shop in Cheyenne. Easily top 3 customer service in Cheyenne. Period.

After staying in Denver for the week I decided to make the two-hour track up to Cheyenne so I could cross another state off of my bucket list. Of course, the drive made me a bit peckish, and this burger place came highly rated on Yelp. I'm glad I stopped in, as the servers were more than friendly and the burger was juicy, fresh, and cooked exactly the way I asked for. Make sure to sample the fries and the many dipping sauces. I don't know if I'll ever find my way back to Wyoming, but if I do, I'll be sure to give this place another visit.

Great food and amazing service! Whether you want to be sat upstairs or downstairs, the waiters and waitresses are always polite to seat you. Very nice place inside. The servers do seem to ask if you want a refill every 2 minutes or so, but i think it’s great that they are always there and ready to help. Would definitely recommend! Also they have the best ranch in town!

Probably the best Burger shop in Cheyenne. Extremely tasty burgers with bottomless fries. Accompany that with the friendly and energetic crew that is always eager to help you or refill your soda. Definitely will be back.

name: Wasabi
reviews: Wasabi is one of my favorite sushi places in Cheyenne, Wyoming. But the service has always varied in star rating. Lately our server has been real good, she serves the bar area. The food doesn't taste like store bought. They have options, and real good food.

I am always hesitant with sushi restaurants, no where near an ocean. The interior  decorations and attention to detail on style convinced me to give them a chance.
We were not disappointed.
The four of us ate 7 rolls. The flavors all stood out as we ate and offer a nice variety on the palate. My only complaint was one of the rolls was topped with scallop, crab and shrimp, the the scallops tasted raw, zero texture and slimy. Super gross. But it is a personal thing, so make your own decision. Server said it was all cooked. 
We will definitely be back.

Great food and priced right -- the sushi was really good, the fried chicken is decent, and the tempura ice cream was great.  

The standard sushi items are under $6-$7, which is less costly that other Japanese restaurants that I've visited.

Hopefully they'll serve ramen on weekends.  Their website is not that clear -- update is needed.
Was our first time eating Japanese food. The food was amazing and I was stuffed from a bowl of ramen. My daughter really enjoyed her sushi.
Food tasty. Environment fun. Restaurant clean.

name: Wyoming's Rib & Chop House, Cheyenne
reviews:
While here in town we heard about Wyoming's Rib & Chop house from many locals and it was everything that they said and more. Our party ordered local micro brew, Buffalo Rib Eye, shrimp and hot wings and it was all very amazing. 

The Buffalo Rib Eye was so juicy, tender and DELICIOUS. It came with 2 sides and it was very filling. 

The succulent food was coupled with Top Notch service from our server Ashley. She was fun and her personality was such a great fit for the environment. We will gladly spread the word about this place. Thank you Ashley and thank you Wyoming's Rib & Chop House

I was impressed by this place.   I heard about it and said let me give it a try. You can call in for reservations or walk in . The decorum really brings this place to life.  The staff friendly  and on point.   Also the wine. If not sure they do offer taste tester to try which i always like that option b4 buying a bottle.   The food was amazing Juicy soft and satisfying.

I was unpleasantly surprised with this restaurant. Based on the appearance, prices, and google reviews, I walked in the door with the expectation to be impressed. 
We were seated immediately despite how busy it was. The hostess took our drink order where I ordered a double jack and coke and my husband ordered a double jack on the rocks. She asked him if he wanted it tall or short so he clarified that it didn't matter because it's just supposed to be jack and ice. She still looked confused as she walked away. When our actual waitress came, we very politely asked if he could get the correct drink. She was quick to take the drink and walked away to get it fixed. Moments later, another individual came up and told us that it WAS jack on the rocks. We politely explained the situation again, and said there was definitely coke in his. She told us again that it WAS jack on the rocks, but she would fix it anyway. She then went to the hostess to discuss the situation again. Once they figured out where the mistake was made, they felt the need to come back and explain. Finally about 10 minutes later, he had the right drink. It's great that they eventually fixed the mistake, but better customer service would be to simply fix the issue. We weren't upset or rude, we simply wanted it fixed. The constant back and forth and explanation was unnecessary and unprofessional. 

Later we ordered our food which came in a somewhat timely manner. Both of my 6 year old kids LOVE popcorn shrimp, so they ordered the popcorn shrimp off of the kids menu. They ate a few bites and kept saying it was spicy, so I finally tried it. I actually truly like spicy food so I enjoyed it, but it was legitimately spicy. This was surprising to me considering the fact that it was on the CHILDREN'S menu. When I mentioned this to the waitress, she apologized and took the price of the food off the bill. 

I ordered the 6oz famous filet with truffle butter which lacked any amount of flavor. I also upgraded to a premium side, asparagus. The side came with only 4 pieces of asparagus. 

I did the food tour in the summer of 2019 but we only split chicken and waffles, so I didn't get much experience at that time. Based on what I read online and what I saw there that first time around, I had high hopes for our full meal there, however was quite disappointed.

We had went on a weeks long road trip back in February and this place was our favorite out of all the resturants we stop at. We were surprised to see some Louisiana taste all the way in Wyoming. Being from Louisiana our family thoroughly enjoyed all their meals, from the gumbo to the crab crusted chicken, all of it was excellent. I even had a picky kid that wanted breakfast food and she was even satisfied.

4-27-20    a takeout 
Ordered a Ribeye with fries and broccoli on a side.  $36 - kinda pricey but I was hungry and have no time to look for another steakhouse. The best part of my meal was the broccoli, the steak was ruined. It was WAY OVER-SALTED and overcooked.

name: Good Friends
reviews: Just ate their food tonight for supper via takeout, and the food was delicious!  Service was awesome!  Staff very friendly!  I'd give them 10 stars if I could!  Thank you Good Friends!  1st time eating your food & I'll definitely be back soon!

Food was made fresh and staff was friendly.  Lots of lunch specials to choose from and priced well.  We got garlic wings, beef on a stick, Mongolian beef and twice cooked pork, and meal came with cup of soup as well.  Food was not spicy, and also I'm used to food being a little bit sweeter so that was a change.  It was a good meal, but I think I prefer sweeter and more spicy flavor.  I would go again and maybe order dishes like orange or sesame chicken for the sweeter taste.

Awful. 

Ordered Lo Mien and Beef and Broccoli. New cooks or someone has gone smell blind. The noodles were overcooked and they didn't add vegetables. The Beef and Broccoli tasted exactly like the noodles.  The fried rice was plain brown rice and didn't even have soy sauce. I'm not a cook but I think things should have their own balance and definitely different flavors.

Save your money, walk into Sams Club, and buy whatever they have. Not only will you save money...you won't leave disappointed!
Everything was absolutely exquisite.  We enjoyed the very best Chinese food we've ever had.  The prices were great, too.  It's my new favorite restaurant in Cheyenne.

Ordered the orange chicken and spicy garlic beef the food had great flavor. The egg rolls are more like spring rolls but again good flavor and crisp. That crab cream cheese wantons were great with flavor but I wish their was more filling. Overall I will definitely be back to eat again.

name: Napoli's
reviews: The food here is amazing it is truly the fine Italian food that Cheyenne has been missing. It definitely leans a little more to the fine dining aspect instead of the family dining that they advertise. Make sure to try their fresh baked bread, additionally we had the Napoli's Special and the Chicken Fettuccine Alfredo. The sauces are to die for!
Absolutely loved the food and services.  Great place to go. Customer service was excellent.  Great price as well. The chocolate cake was amazing.  Can't wait to go back.

The food is wonderful and never have a problem with the service. Everytime we come in they are professional and the owners are wonderful and very friendly. We have been here over five more times and the food and service has never been disappointing. It just keeps getting better

This is my second time visiting Napoli’s and again it was delicious. We took friends this time and they very much enjoyed their meal as well. I love the Art Deco ambiance and the wait staff are top notch. Doesn’t get much better than wonderful atmosphere, attentive staff and excellent food. We’ll be back.

The calamari was very very much frozen and then microwaved. Tough and chewy.  Reassembled fish sticks from grocery store. I ordered the eggplant parmesan, it was average, neither good nor bad. Atmosphere was nice, very art deco. Service was excellent.  However I probably will not be coming back.

name: Outback Steakhouse
reviews: Great food and welcoming atmosphere. Wait staff was on his first day and did great! Steak was cooked just the way I ordered add fries were hot when food came to the table. I always enjoy the loaf bread to tide me over until the meal comes.

I went for lunch on a Saturday. Not very many people. Service was 5 star. Prices were a little to much. Food taste ok. I had the 6oz Sirloin with coconut shrimp  and mashed potato. The other plate is Lamb, Mac and cheese, and sweet potato.

First time going there tonight and it was amazing! Amazing food! I ordered what the waitress recommended and it was delicious. The waitress was so great. Was there to check on us and was happy to get us what we needed and everything we needed. Was great on refilling drink! Amazing service.
Super great service,  food was okay. I've eaten there before and its been much better. Our waitress was great though!
The service was great, attentive, and timely. The food was excellent and very well prepared. I would go out of my way to come to this location again if I was near Cheyenne.

name: Twin Dragon
reviews: I loved it. Cute plates for the lil ones! Small place but cozy. We had a large family ❤ great on drink refills. Buffet was good with seafood options. Love the hot and sour soup. Not bad price for what you get at all. Even the dessert area was clean and had many options.
Great Mandarin and Szechuan style asian food, amazing prices and they also offer a buffet during certain hours. Authentic and diverse menu with loads to choose from, and always great service.
Everything was delicious. Will definitely be going back next time were going through cheyenne.

Terrible service. The hostess is very rude and is the manager's daughter. So if you want them to fix your order...good luck. They're going to make you pay. Tried telling me that they gave us orange chicken...but it was clearly pork. She just argued with us and made us pay for more. Then they messed it up again...Same order. They then proceeded to try and make me pay MORE. FOR A THIRD TIME. Very displeased with this place. I'll make sure to go to China Buffet instead.

Terrible Service, the hostess is the managers daughter so good luck getting anything on your order fixed. They are rude and just don’t care. Literally got home and they gave us pork instead of Chicken and then continued to argue with us saying it was chicken. Got there to fix it and when we went to leave our order was wrong AGAIN. They tried getting us to pay 3 times when we already paid twice for the order. Highly disappointed will go somewhere else next time.

name: Mongolian Grill
address: 1637 Stillwater Ave STE C, Cheyenne, WY 82009, USA
reviews: Made a stop here for lunch and was not disappointed. There was an array of vegetables, meats and sauces to choose from. Sizes of bowls were small to large in size. Discovered theres a way to arrange everything to get maximum amount for the $$ according to repeat customers. Veggies, loose leaf veggies and meat, apply sauce, then top with a heaping mound of noodles. I shall try next visit. Even the price was reasonable for what you get so I have no complaints. Rice and a chicken noodle kind of egg drop soup was included. Don't recommend getting water tasted like it was straight from tap. Overall I enjoyed the food an atmosphere. Waitresses were friendly and so was our cook. If you're in Cheyenne be sure to stop in and try this hidden treasure.

The experience is cool!! Watching the guys cook on the big round flat top, go round and round is neat. The cooks are always pleasant and nice. The food seems prepared fresh and generally always fully stocked. 3 sizes are available Sm Med and Lrg. Med bowl runs about $9 for dinner and your almost always guaranteed leftovers. You get too choose what you want in it as far as veggies, meat and sauces. You can get complimentary rice and soup. The girls that help seat and check out customers are on and off and ya never know what you will get. You will leave full and satisfied!! So good.
This place is good. For the money it’s kinda steep when you have to figure out what tastes good with sauces I have never tried. Either way it’s still good just not for me for the price

This is one of my favorite places to eat at. The food is delicious and taste great reheated the next day. The staff has always been very friendly. I hate to see new staff members everytime I go in. The place definitely needs to be updated, but it's still comfortable and welcoming.

Food was good. Service was good. Cooks looked miserable. The ceiling is greasy and dirty. There were small rocks in the hot sauce that my husband and I both chomped down upon and hurt our teeth. They need get their hot sauce from a higher quality source to prevent this from happening again. Don't get hot sauce in your food.

name: Hathaways Restaurant & Lounge
reviews: We "discovered" Hathaways Restaurant & Lounge on Google Maps, looking for a nice restaurant. This was one of the best restaurants we ever eaten in our (long) travels.
Dining room closes at 10p. Staying in hotel and wanted a late dinner to go. Arrived at 945p. Service was friendly and excellent. Burger and fries were fantastic.
Good food and atmosphere. Would have had another beer if asked before happy hour ended.

Amazing.  This place should have been packed. Amazing food, decor, background music and service.  A MUST stop for an amazing meal.  The gift stop is remarkable.  We will be back to stay for a few days!  So relaxing and amazing!

Not very good had a reservations had to wait 30 Mins. To get our table the person at the door didn't make us feel welcome finally got our table. Went and got i line to eat no salad no salad dressing prime rib was over cooked dry and cold no shrimp no rolls alot of food was empty also the servers doing the food where not wearing gloves 60 bucks a plate is crazy not happy i was told when i called it was 35 per plate not happy won't be back i will say the server was great .

name: Luxury Diner
reviews: The service was impecable. The food was made fresh and tasted delicious. Portions were huge, so much that I was not able to Finnish my meal. Old school hospitality at a great value. Definitely a place to stop by.

Lots of food for a really good price. I always love what I am served and they have phenomenal staff. It does get busy so I recommend. Going on a weekday for breakfast. The pancakes are some of the best I have had in town.
Food and atmosphere are amazing. I love the old time diner this place is. Much recommended.
Excellent place to eat! Loved our breakfast and our waitress did a great job! Friendly and cozy diner! 💗💗

Their curbside service goes above and beyond. Locally unique with a killer green chili breakfast burrito. Breakfast choices include German sausage, chrizzo and gigantic thick sliced bacon. Order eggs any style, french toast and whole grain breads.

name: China Buffet
address: 1958 Dell Range Blvd, Cheyenne, WY 82009, USA
reviews: Food was excellent! Buffet was well stocked and kept clean. The only issue we had was our server did not stay on top of things as frequently as he should have (drink refills mostly) or I would have given 5 stars.

This was a good place to eat. My hubby and I stopped here while we were out for dinner. The buffet was stocked full of food and it was good. Some of it was rather cold though. Otherwise, no complaints. I’d recommend you check it out.

Chefs regularly check to see if food server dishes need refilling. They also bring a  cloth to wipe spills. Price is really fair for a great array of food. A host is available for queries at all times. Consistency with dishes. They do not "skimp" or hold back on expensive mushrooms and shrimp. A lady host proudly shared that people come from all over to have lunch/dine at China Buffet, Cheyenne *****Best in Colorado..Best in Wyoming..that l have tasted. Servings should be moderate. Digest well and savor.
If Asian food not your daily consumption, it is inadvisable not to overindulge; as with spicy, firy hot Indian food. Your gut may not welcome it.

We love coming in to eat. We are always greeted quickly and friendly.  Everyone there is welcoming  and so happy to help. The food is always great. If they are running low on  something they are happy to make more fresh.

We have gone to dinner twice here and each time the restroom is very clean. The food is fresh and yummy. The staff are all helpful and nice. I do wish the desert items were placed together and perhaps a couple more choices. We love the place and will return. Also, very affordable!!

name: Capitol Cuisine
reviews: Not too bad, but room for improvement as all young businesses have. Staff are friendly and are prepared to assist customers. Soups of the day were pulled pork and potato or cream of broccoli. Both were scrumptious. My Ruben came a little disassembled and the bread was grilled but a little cooler than I would have liked, also felt like there wasn’t enough Ruben invited on the sandwich itself. The lettuce on the salad bar was wilting and the service promptly replaced it at our request. My self assembled salad was alright overall but felt like their weren’t enough fresh toppings. The salad dressings could be labeled. Utensils looked like they could use a good scrub.

Skip the chain restaurants and come to Capital Cuisine. You will not be sorry! The people are awesome, and the food is amazing. Husband had the fish basket with fries, soup and salad, and I had the cheesesteak with onion rings. Oh my! Definitely going to stop in anytime we are in Cheyenne.

The sandwiches here are excellent. The sandwich I had was a BLT with extra bacon, I believe they called it the Koop. The bacon was flavorful abd wasn't that paper thin stuff you get at some places.

It is a casual dining that is family owned. There menu covers a whole wall, it is a giant chalkboard with the menu written on it. It takes a little while to take it all in the first time.
This was by far one of the best places I have been to that has one of the best tomato soup and the Reuben sandwich was by far one of the best I have had in a long time.
Ate a roast beef panini, salad and soup, probably won't eat again till tomorrow morning.

name: Olive Garden Italian Restaurant
address: 1536 Dell Range Blvd, Cheyenne, WY 82009, USA
reviews: Nice waitress who only knew basics of her job.  Entrees a little overdone but tasty and adequate.  Pleasant atmosphere with children in holiday mode! Ended with extra effort by waitress with yummy dessert with coffee!   Certainly will go again and hope for our usual 4 star experience.

Honestly, one of the best things about Olive Garden is the consistency. I've been to many different Olive Gardens in multiple States and you can always count on the same quality of food and for the most part service. Their lunch special for all you can eat soup and salad is very well priced and a great option for lunch. Definitely recommend and will continue to frequent

Placed an order for pick up due to the dine in being closed. Horrible experience. Our pasta had no sauce but a lot of butter in the bottom when it was suppose to be fettuccine alfredo, my husband got the seafood and there was hardly any in there, the portions were so small. Also with our salads there was little to no dressing. We go here for almost every holiday, very disappointed!

I had a wonderful experience during my meal at Olive Garden today, typically the service is quite average and the food is tasty, but not today. Our server Mrs. Katie in the Cheyenne branch was phenomenal, she was very sweet and professional. Though she had several tables to take care of no one was forgotten, Mrs. Katie truly took my Olive Garden experience to a whole new level. I wish I would’ve gotten her full name so that I may thank her directly. Give her a raise Olive Garden!! My girlfriend and I will definitely be returning soon and I plan to request her as my server once again. 12/26/2019 - Cheyenne WY

Nice place to have a dinner. The staff were busy but we didn't wait too long. I enjoyed my meal - we shared the salad for 3 and I had chicken with smashed potatoes and sauce with mushrooms. That would be a typical food for a Latvian person. Waitress was very kind and brought some little chocolate bars as we didn't save room for the dessert.

name: Tortilla Factory Express
address: 1507 Stillwater Ave # G, Cheyenne, WY 82009, USA
reviews: These guys have THE BEST green chili smothered breakfast burritos around. Order the steak and egg, you wont be dissapointed. Their lunch and dinner offerings are great too.... Can't really go wrong here.
In Wyoming looking for tasty Mexican food? ... Here it is. Clean, friendly staff, easy access, plenty of parking. Chips & salsa were good too 😋

Nice little restaurant located right off Dell Range. This branch of TF caters more to take out, so I wish they’d stay open later into the night. Disposable plates and silverware are used when eating in, but that’s no biggie. Great food, and great staff!
The carne asada wasn't very good. The other food we got was pretty ok. Not a horrible place but not the best cheyenne has to offer.
excellent food. probably the best Mexican restaurant here in town by far

name: Culver's
address: 1239 Dell Range Blvd, Cheyenne, WY 82009, USA
reviews: Probably the best fast food type place for a burger around here. The bacon butter burger is delicious, especially the one with the pretzel bun. The fries are nothing to write home about, but not bad for crinkle cut fries. The cheese curds are decent, but I personally prefer the ones Bdubs has. Side wise, I'd say to go for the onion rings.  Shakes and malts are top notch. They are a bit pricey compared to other burger places but pretty great overall. Pretty similar to Freddy's but better. I've gotten in the habit of referring to Freddy's as "Less good Culver's."

Culver’s is a special place treat for my family. Driving up it’s located in a nice part of town and grounds are kept up very nicely which makes it very inviting. 

The drive throughs menu is easy to read but I always encourage having an idea of what you want before you because they have some to choose from. 

Like the sign says everything is made fresh and everything can be customized to how you want it. We got burgers and custard ice cream .

A few years ago when I first had their frozen custard, very tasty, it took me back decades.  Had to travel 50 miles to Cheyenne to get it.  Now we have a Freddies in Laramie and their frozen custard is much better.

No stars today. Yep, that is right, you read that correctly. They made five, count them five mistakes on our order. They have usually only made one or two mistakes on our orders in the past but this time they made five, count them five mistakes on our order. We went there to get some take out for dinner so I will post there comments about the events.

Mistake One... We ordered 2 concrete short marshmallow cookie dough drinks. The person taking our order only rang up one. They did make us another one after we complained.

Mistake TWO... We checked our order and found they forgot the chicken tender 2 piece snack pack which was on our receipt. They made us a new one.

Mistake THREE... While they made us a  chicken tender 2 piece snack pack and they put it in a bag they forgot the small fries that should have been included. They did make that one for us.

Mistake FOUR... After we drove all the way home and opened our order we noticed they forgot our butter burger. I called and was told it would be ready for when I got there. I had to drive over six miles one way to get it. All the way from the south side of town to dell range then all the way to the west end of dell range for the food. Then all of the way back home for the second time today during quitting time!

Mistake FIVE... When I got to their business they had not even started my replacement. I still had to wait for my new sandwich. They seemed to be on the short side with a lot of rudeness with me about their mistakes! So I finally got my sandwich and drove home. By the time I got home the fries and onion rings were very cold. The chicken strips were barely warm. We WERE VERY DISAPPOINTED!

I only saw what looked like young people running this greasy fast food joint. All of them looked like their ages were in the late teens to early 20's. You people messed up five times on our! Why do you have foolish employees working there without an adult supervisor? The fools you have as employees probably need a baby sitter. Could it be because your pay for an adult baby sitter is about half of the poverty level? You foolishly allowed ignorant employees to make five mistakes on our order this time. We are not the only customers sick of your ignorant employees constantly making mistakes!

The only thing I can say positive is that a small percentage of your  employees are pleasant to the customers. That is until you complain about mistakes on our orders. Then your employees are very rude and even bordering on being threatening to us the customers. The employees at some of the other greasy fast foods in Cheyenne are not only rude when you call them on a mistake but many of them border on threatening behavior when you complain about a mistake.

Many Cheyenne residents refuse to ever go to your food place ever again. On another note, just how many cronies do you have posting bogus positive reviews on google? Looks like about half of these posiitve reviews are cronies to most of us in Cheyenne. We will never use you eating place again!
Great food, family environment. The pork tenderloin sandwiches are delicious!

name: Perkins Restaurant & Bakery
address: 1730 Dell Range Blvd, Cheyenne, WY 82009, USA
reviews: Very nice.  Burger deal was excellent.  $9.99 for a burger, fries and pie.  Service was great.  Meal was hot and served in a timely manner.  Refills on drinks were great. Atmosphere was warm and friendly, not overcrowded. Checkout clerk was friendly.

Food was good but service was slow by server, floors were messy, needed a quick clean, several managers at front but no one really working the floor to ensure smooth service. Would come back again as food is great, but need to expect better delivery of service from ALL staff.

Our server, Lucy, was awesome!  Our food was very good too!  When we went to pay the bill however, the gal who rang us up was very grouchy.  She was upset that we were splitting the bill.  Then we asked to buy some of the bakery items, she acted like she was inconvenienced.   To top it off, she didn't get that order right and acted like it was our fault.   I hope she has a better day.

I can't really complain about this perkins, as there is not another one near by for comparison. I have had several commendable meals here but today's meal struck out. I have complained to to the staff about their dirty syrup containers and nothing has changed. My eggs were not properly cooked, I was given bacon that was partially raw and the pancakes were not properly cooked either. I do not like pancakes that have a doughy taste. I will eventually return and I would preferred to have left a positive review.

We love Perkins! The atmosphere is wonderful. The waiters and waitresses are always attentive and friendly. The menu is varied and the food is always delicious. We especially like buy one get one free on Wednesdays. It makes it very affordable for those of us on a fixed budget to get to eat out once in a while.

name: Renzios Greek Food
address: 1400 Dell Range Blvd, Cheyenne, WY 82007, USA
reviews: Food is good, better than what you'd expect from a mall restaurant. Staff was very friendly and helpful with questions that didn't pertain to their own store. Would recommend adding a condiment dispenser instead of having a large box of ketchup packets during on a table.

At first glance Renzios seems like your typical fast food joint, but I was pleasantly surprised. Their service is friendly, fast and restaurant is clean. The food was very good and satisfying with large portions for a competitive price!

Renzios is one of my haunts for sure. Great food, diverse staff, and people watching.
Remember “Bowie” knows best
Love Renzios! One of my favorite places to eat, especially within the mall. The service is great and the food is delicious! 100% would recommend.
Food used to be good. Great service. Then staff changed and some new blond girl always fondling the owner... Yeesh. Creepy and unsanitary conditions all of a sudden. Won't go back.

name: Epic Egg Restaurants Cheyenne
reviews: Awesome little spot for a delicious breakfast! Good quality and good portions! Always have amazing customer service every time, my only complaint is that the Va-Va-Vegan dish is NOT all the way vegan. The main dish is but the toast is not, but if you ask for no butter you should be good! I would love if they invested in some vegan butter, but other than that this place is my top spot for a delicious Cheyenne brunch!
Pumpkin waffle was awesome. Bacon was pretty rubbery. Guest  that I was with eggs where a little undercooked. Our server was quick, and professional. Over all a decent breakfast joint.

Place is pretty good. They were out of the 2 things my husband and I wanted to eat. Everyone is super friendly. It's very clean and organized. Green chile is pretty good just has no kick at all :( their country potatoes and French toast are yummy! Just wish it was better priced.
One of the best breakfasts we have ever had in the states. Absolutely egg-cellent. Can’t wait to go back for an ‘I mean business mimosa’!

Amazing rebrand! The food was awesome and the staff was so nice!! They also now offer mimosas which was a super fun treat!! Even during their busy hour our food came out super fast and accurate. Great for people with dietary restrictions and allergies!!!

name: Chick-fil-A
reviews: Chick-fil-A is in my top 3 favorite restaurants of all time. The food is always fresh and tasty. There is not a single competitor in the fast food business when it comes to customer service. I was so  impressed today when I went to eat here. I went a little after 2 so they had been in a lunch rush for a few hours now. The line of cars using the drive through was so long it almost went out of the parking lot. I found a parking stop and went inside. The line inside almost went out the door. I was a little worried it would take a long time to get my food. I could see that the people working here were not panicking like most fast food employees when its busy. They kept working hard and stayed positive and efficient. In all the craziness they stayed polite and professional. Chick-fil-A sets the standard for all others.

The drive-through was incredibly quick and the staff were very kind and helpful. The location itself is quite far out of my way, however if you're nearby, it's a great place to stop for lunch. I can highly recommend going to this location over the other Cheyenne location because this location is a dedicated location. The other one is in a mall which is far slower and the employees weren't as nice.

Same good normal Chick-fil-A food. Sometimes the staff isn't super great or if you ask for an alternation to the menu item like no pickles, they aren't the best. Also, they can have long wait times. The online pay and order always seems to be not working at this location for me as well.
This place has the fastest drive thru ever. The food is always great, service is super friendly and professional.

Great location, great food and great service!!  Love the new gluten free buns that you can now get with any of the grilled chicken sandwiches, they bring it out with the bun in it's own wrapper and the chicken in a container so you know they haven't been cross contaminated.  Love cfa!!

name: QDOBA Mexican Eats
address: 1958 Dell Range Blvd Unit F, Cheyenne, WY 82009, USA
reviews: A great experience that Is bow a horrible experiance. They know you cant see how they make your food now. Let me tell you what to expect. Dry hard rice, Graying guacamole, Cold meat and a torn apart quesadilla. I know chipotle isnt for everyone but they will be taking my money until covid-19 is over and I can see the quality of the food agian.

I am completely shocked with their inability to fulfill an actual catering order. I ordered for a caterer of 10. Requested cilantro rice, what was delivered was some pale Brown half seasoned rice. Also added on fajitas vegetables for 10. What was provided was fajita vegetables for 3. Same with the cheese it literally was enough for about 6 individual tacos and in no way fulfilled an order of 10 individuals. Certainly not my last complaint or issue but a majority of the lettuce was old brown and withered.
I also understand that there are literally charges for everything. However I was charged an additional $50 for 20 flour tortillas which were dry cold and stale. Overall it was a very unpleasant and very underwhelming. I personally will not be back to this establishment and do not recommend.
Great food and great customer service! The food was fresh as well. 5 stars for me.

The pulled pork bowl was bland. The steak bowl was over spiced. Taking bites back and forth made both taste better. I ordered to go and it seemed to take a long time. I think they were understaffed. I'm not sure I'll go back when there are other comparable options close by.
The food was great, *the portion sizes will do you in! Lol..HUGE burrito* the customer service was excellent, the food tasted fresh and it makes my heart happy they are vegetarian/vegan friendly.

name: The Metropolitan Downtown
reviews: Stopped in for lunch. The artichoke dip was amazing! Paired with the hot Italian sandwich, it was a perfect lunch. Very upscale place. Wait staff was on point without being pestering. I give it five stars!

Great experience. Everything we had was delicious, including the burger, Brussels sprouts, and lasagna. Some things on the menu are pretty expensive but there are definitely cheaper options as well. Our bill was pretty reasonable for the quality. Our server was great as well! Will definitely be back.

Was really excited for a brunch place in town.... received my biscuits and gravy and they were completely cold in the center. This made me completely lose my appetite.... and then they still tried to charge me for them. I had to track down a manager to get it off my bill. Poor restaurant decorum.

The service here was phenomenal, and the food was great. The atmosphere is almost retro, and the bathrooms are clean and beautiful. I had the chicken wings and charcuterie, the chicken breast, and we tried all three of the desserts. Everything was perfect.

Stopped in today for lunch. Took an hour to bring 3 salads and a sandwich. To top it off we watched the steak sandwich sit on the warmer for over 15 minutes. The sever did his best and was very nice but for an $80 lunch and $16 glass of wine, I'd expect much more. All we got were several apologies but nothing from upper management as we watched him walk to every table and skip ours. The food was pretty tasty, I will give them that.

name: Rx Tea Time
reviews: My wife and I went to Rx Tea Time for a Sunday day date, and we had an absolutely lovely experience. We had the Afternoon Tea Setting which I would highly recommend. The tea was top shelf, the food was delicious, and the service was great. Wanda and Jim were amazing, so friendly, and have created such a wonderful experience for tea lovers in Cheyenne!! We will be telling our friends about this hidden gem and coming back, hopefully soon!
Beautiful Victorian tea house.  Wonderful service, delicious food, and fun atmosphere.
I came here for the first time over the weekend and had a lovely experience! The tea and pastries were delicious, and the hats were super stylish
Absolutely the BEST tea I've been too.   Wanda was very attentive and shared the history of their tea shop.   The scones were AMAZING! So happy I found her tea shop.
The lady that runs the place is so kind, and I enjoy my experience everytime. The food and teas are absolutely fantastic ! Highly suggest going for the experience.

name: Hi Sushi
reviews:
I buy donuts next register over. And I had to say their sushi is best! It is delicious!
Price point it's good! Being from Vegas 
it's the best price. I would recommend this to anyone. I will definitely come back!  

Friendly staff too!

Best sushi and Donuts around!

thank you!
Came in for the 3 roll lunch special that is from 10:30am - 2pm Monday-Friday  I was not disappointed. Great customer service. Really good sushi.
Better than the big sushi place downtown! Love this place
Amazing food both donuts and sushi/ teriyaki owner is such a great guy one of the best restaurants in town!

BEST SUSHI IN TOWN!! Can not say this enough. Easily the best sushi in town and their donuts are great as well. The people who own the place are always friendly and always there with a smile as you walk in the door. Fantastic service every time.

name: Rolando's Mexican Grill
address: 1829 Dell Range Blvd, Cheyenne, WY 82009, USA
reviews: Good food but HORRIBLE customer service skills. We went there around 9pm since they’re open 24 hours, and we pulled up to the box to order and sat for 20 minutes. Nobody ever answered. There was a line of cars behind us. Not to mention when I pulled up to the window, they were BLARING their music and were screaming just to hear each other talk. I called the store 3 times and they just let the phone ring ever single time, I could hear it ringing inside from the drive through window and they all ignored it. We honked several times and knocked on the window and they just looked at us. ALL open signs were on. We finally left after 20 minutes at the ordering box and 20 at the window.
Great food and service. The best corn tortillas EVER!! We will be back. #24 Rancho Plate
First time here! Food was amazing!!! Big servings We will go back again and again yummy

I loved this place! I try to pay attention to staff and theirs was amazing; friendly, nice, professional, and welcoming... Very authentic tasting food! I will make sure and stop in here at least once a month. Highly recommend, 10/10!
Best breakfast burrito ever! You have to try this place! ❤️

name: Village Inn
reviews: Very busy on a Saturday morning.  Which means they have a local following.   We were seated in a timely manner.  Our sever, Natalia was great!  Food was as ordered, and we enjoyed our visit.  Thank you.

The food was good and our server paid the appropriate amount of attention to us. 
I had their new chicken fried steak breakfast burrito. It was large and completely filled me up. It was an initial shock of having white gravy on my burrito, but appropriate for chicken fried steak. For a hot sauce I put Chalula, though I would have preferred Chipotle Tobasco Sauce but they didn't have any. My wife had their Garden Skillet which looked good.

Usually end up ordering make your own breakfast platter. Just can't eat the huge food servings, so I like having smaller options and always get a piece of pie to go for teatime. Great wait staff, friendly management.

The food is good, if its not then it is your fault because you put everything together.
Our waitress was great and kept checking on us and talking with us.
We always do large bowls so we can take the leftovers home for lunch the next day.
The decor is not that great, but it is clean and we are there to eat and not to look at the surroundings.
Great Food, Devony is the best!!! Coffee is awesome and served in a unlimited carafe the atmosphere is homie clean and unhurried and free pie on Wednesday Man I luv this place -JJ

name: Diamond Horseshoe Cafe
reviews: The staff here are always so kind and welcoming. Food is great and at a low price.  I will definitely continue to support them. Great to have them in the community!

My dad recommended this place because it was his go-to for breakfast when he lived in Cheyenne. He told me I HAD to get the German Sausage and Eggs. It didn't disappoint. Will be back if I'm ever back in Cheyenne.
Taste of home with a fantastic breakfast and wonderful customer service! I can't wait to go back.

Just visiting Cheyenne and found this place.  Are we glad we did. The entire staff is externally friendly. They treated us like we have known them since grade school. Haley was our server and she is fantastic. She treated us just like family. The regular customers are friendly.

The food is very good.  From breakfast to lunch items, everyone in our group loved their meal. 
Eating out is a treat, going to a place that values your business, prepares a quality meal at a great value makes it that much easier to decide to spend your money at the Diamond Horseshoe Cafe.

Omg words can not describe how good the food is. Broke down at the freightliner dealership and they where very kind and friendly to deliver me food within 20 minutes if that. I will definitely be getting food from them again.

name: Down Home Diner
reviews: Chicken fried really good. It was busy, but the few employees  that were there kept everybody   pleased. A+  to the waitresses, waiter,cooks. We really enjoyed are hot breakfast. Will definitely  return.

1st time food and service was awesome Trey our server was very attentive food was hot brewed fresh coffee for hubby. We had set out for another reg spot called Perkins however we forgot about the time changed and they were packed so we went in search of food elsewhere and found the Down Home Diner. Even though it was 9:30 am they said it was no problem ordering typical lunch/dinner food we weren't in the mood for breakfast food that morning. We will be repeat customers. Great job

Their food really hit the spot. Fast and courteous service, clean and quaint appearance, close to lodging. Their meatloaf dinner was excellent. Blueberry pie made the perfect dessert. Highly recommended.
Main dishes were good, staff pleasant, the sides ... not so great.

Food, service & ambience did not meet our expectations. Interestingly, a waitress stood on an adjacent booth seat to close the blinds in our booth rather than simply asking if we wanted them closed in the morning. There was also only one set of silverware for a family of four so we had to ask for more after the food had been served.

name: Rodolfo's Mexican Grill
reviews: Best late night Mexican food in town. Might even be best during the day too. Amazing tacos and their rice and beans are spot on.

I just moved here from Vegas and was in search of a place that was open late since I work nights. The food was awesome!

I recommend walking in instead of the the drive through, it's a bit narrow.

I will be coming back thank you!
OMG SO FREAKING GOOD!!! Try the Carnitas Burrito and the cheese and guacamole fries. To. Die. For.

Good food but consistently horrible service. The short fat man has forgotten items in our order at the drive through at least four times. The short fat man has also incorrectly overcharged us. This same short fat man looked right at us and saw us at the cash register ready to order, he ignored us to just stand there only to slump over to the counter after ignoring us for literally over a minute. He is constantly short and rude every time we come in, acting as if we are annoyances for simply ordering. It kinda ruins the restaurant for me because the short fat man works a lot. The rest of the staff is great. Save the hassle and just go to Rolando's instead.

Sometimes I wonder about the food, I know some people can be pretty nasty at times. Take that for what it's worth.. I'm jus sayin Other than that, why is it they never have the breakfast borrito when I go there at 5 am ? I'm not sure if the just donn't like me or what.

name: Chipotle Mexican Grill
address: 1508 Dell Range Blvd, Cheyenne, WY 82009, USA
reviews: Good food, though it is no true Mexican food. My wife and I had the Chicken Burrito, but customized them to our own tastes. I was glad to see that they had Chipotle Tobasco Sauce, I love it. Thier chips are tasty with a hint of lime.

***Paid through app after ordering our food but did not get our food but was still charged*** I am extremely upset with Chiptole right now.  We ordered food from the app and placed our order and paid through the app.  However, when we went to pick up our food, the store was closed (April 28th).  Our credit card has since been charged for the food we never received.  We have tried just about every avenue to contact Chipotle but are unable to contact them.  I have sent a message through their website and have tried multiple times to call them (both corporate and local) but can not get a hold of anyone to speak to regarding this issue.  We are taking this issue further because this is highly unsettling now, especially given the circumstances with the pandemic.  Very upset and highly disappointed at the lack of response to our problem.

The food and service here are good, but they need to change their attempt at social distancing considering what is happening right now. Every other place I have been to without a drive thru is doing curbside, i.e, bringing orders to your car. Here they make you enter the building area and wait in an enclosed, small foyer region along with everyone else waiting for their orders.  This fosters a situation which is way too crowded and is the exact opposite of what we are supposed to be doing right now regarding six-foot buffers.  People are way too close together.  Until they change this I won't be going back.
Terribly rude and the lady kept shaking all the steak from the half of a scoop she had on there.  The smallest Chipotle burrito I've ever seen....not worth $8.50...maybe worth $4

Love this restaurant, I’m only giving 3 stars because the service could definitely use some help. I come here a lot for the food, but some of these kids could use some re training in customer service. I’ve watched on multiple occasions people on the line asking for help and other people flat out refusing saying “it’s not their job.” I get that everyone has their own spots that they need to maintain, but when there’s a line of people and one person on the line and you flat out refuse to help...  you’re not only being rude to the person trying to make my food,  but now you’re being very rude to me. Hop on the line!

name: Godfather's Pizza
reviews: Godfathers Pizza is the best pizza in the country. Even Italians would love it. New York and your weird thin slices of pepperoni... eat your heart out. you are doing yourself a huge disservice if you don’t try Godfathers Pizza. Get the taco pizza on regular crust.

Great pizza, make sure to go from 11:30 to 1 everyday or from 5 to close Tuesday Thursday and Saturday for the buffet. If you're there another time make sure to check out the value meals they help make the meal options much more affordable. Also the staff is very helpful and courteous.

Great local pizza place.  Great pizza. Great dessert pizza  The service has always been good when I went. Great place for a family get together. Nice little gaming area for the kiddos as well.  I don't think this place gets it's proper due because it gets over shadowed by the bigger mainstream pizza places in town.

Godfather’s is great! One of my favorite pizza places in town. They fixed the inside up nice and have a lot of arcade games for the kids. Their pizza is always great and the service is good too. Would definitely recommend.
Very good pizza. Had 2 larges both had loads of toppings and best crust I've had in a long time. Great service. Go and enjoy!!

name: Rubyjuice Fruit & Smoothies
reviews: Oh my word. I absolutely LOVE Ruby Juice! They come up with creative smoothies and have classics as well. They are made-to-order. Ruby Juice is located right in the heart of tourist downtown, so in the summer there is almost always a wait. It's worth it! You can customize your shakes, and that's just an added bonus. The iwer is a dream of a woman who remembers her clients. She always gets your order right. Definitely recommend a smoothie from Ruby Juice before you head out of town!
Very nice people and helped me for my first time i had alot of questions which he answered thank you.
I became a regular when I found out this place existed! They already know my custom order when I come in. Great place!

This place is awesome. I get a smoothie frequently in here. The smoothie is one that I picked the ingredients myself.. And the staff is very friendly and professional at the same time. They are very knowledgeable of the nutritional value their menu. Oh .. And the wellness shots are tasty too.

Rubyjuice has some of the most amazing Smoothies in Cheyenne.  You can tell the staff that work there are really committed to making sure that you are happy with what you are ordering and they will anwser any questions you have. 

I'm a big citrus fan, so I've been making my way through the citrus drinks.  Next, the tropical tasting drinks!

name: Accomplice Beer Company
reviews: Awesome pizza and “pork wings” or dry rubbed ribs.  The DIY beer system seems odd at first but actually turned out pretty cool.

Went there for a late lunch with my husband who is a big fan of breweries. He loved the concept of being able to get his own beer. The server was helpful when he had a problem with one of the beers not pouring correctly. We ordered the kale salad and the chicken club, both were excellent. The server was excellent. 
Vegetarian friendly
Accessible
Patio service were you can watch the trains.

I thoroughly enjoyed their beer, pizza and service.  Although I was there at opening 11AM on a Wednesday.  
 The problem came when I  ordered a  2 topping pizza which is $8.  I received a specialty pizza which is three toppings for $10. At the time I didn't realize it was only a $2 difference(thought it was 5).  Well I ate it and it  was delicious.  I didn't even notice the extra topping until about half way through it(because they were skimpy).  Oh well I figured it would be an easy fix when I check out.  I'd pay for the 2 toppings that I ordered. 
 So the counter woman had to get the okay from the manager.  Fine. She thought I wanted it(whole pizza) comped.  Now I was pretty buzzed at this point(still am as I write this).  She brought the check which I was surprised at how cheap it was.  But it didn't compute at the time that she comped the pizza.  
Next I was trying to figure out the tip.  Well if I'm pouring my own beer, there is no service = no tip. That's what tipping is for, service.  I was talking aloud to myself about how much to tip since I poured my own beer.   She then tried to snatch the bill and said "we don't want your money".  I told her I want to tip and I enjoyed myself and the beer and food and I would come back next time I'm in the area. I tipped on the food only. 
I'm not a fan of being my own beertender.  
If anyone is reading this and visits this place, enjoy but don't tip for serving your self. Its kind of a scam.

Went in for the St Louis Ribs that it says they have on the website. They do not have this item on the menu. The "bartender" was not friendly and didn't say anything about getting my own just asked for my debit card and handed me a beer card. Figure it out I guess. If I am back in Cheyenne I will not be back to this brewery.

Drove to Cheyenne from Nebraska after traveling from California. Pulled into town and looked for a place to eat. We found Accomplice and loved the location and decor. Once inside, we knew we had found the right place. The bar was cool, but we were there for lunch and didn't try any beer. Son had pizza, which he loved and we also had salad. Service was friendly and food came out quickly. A great place that would rival some of the best craft beer places we have in Cali. Bought pint glasses to take back home.

name: Cheyenne Country Club Restaurant & Bar
reviews: Beautiful course. Great service.

Very nice atmosphere and great service. I had a prime rib sandwich and it was good. The deserts were outstanding. The restrooms were very nice and clean. The parking is a bit chaotic and finding the door to the restaurant was a bit of a trick.
Prayer Breakfast for the EHS class of 1979.  Best food ever.  Room was perfect for the occasion.
Great golf!
Awsome food

name: Taqueria Mi Tierra
address: 314 Dell Range Blvd, Cheyenne, WY 82009, USA
reviews: I Love this place!!
Genuine Authentic Mexican cuisine. Fantastic flavor, good portions excellent hospitality and service.  A MUST visit.
Delicious and authentic food. Giving 4 stars for having the smell of the grill in dining area. Personal issue. Othee than that the food is well worth the stop.
Food is amazing. Love this hidden gem

Great food and service. Everything is made fresh - right before you. The mildild is mild and the hot is not too hot to take away from the flavor. The chef is flexible and will make items to order. Great place hidden away on Dell Range.

name: Chick-fil-A
address: 1400 Dell Range Blvd Spc 89, Cheyenne, WY 82009, USA
reviews: I ordered here and sat down. The person that delivers the food was busy taking other trays to other tables. The girl who took my order came from behind the counter to give me my food. The teamwork from the staff is incredible. The food was amazing! Will come here again for the lord’s chicken!

I work in the mall, have worked in the mall for three years. I come here often. This location is a lot better than it used to be, even though I won't go in at night because most of the time the service and food quality are terrible. I went in yesterday during lunch and they were so busy but the service was pretty fast and the food was good. I've read some reviews and the manager, Karen, is misunderstood IMO. She has done a lot for this location and has always been very nice to me. If it is busy she is all business. I will continue to go back and I've been told it will get better at night.
I'm a mall employee and just found out Karen, the manager is leaving!!!!! What a bummer.  Bad news for Chick-fil-A. Great news for 5 Guys. Good for you Karen! Now I'll start eating at 5 Guys again.
Great food and  great service. Nice about food allergies (gluten) and very accommodating.
I ordered a 20 piece nugget and I got less thhen 10. They were very small. I did let them know I didn't get what I ordered and they made it right.

name: Casa de Trujillo
reviews: I love this place. Been coming here for years. Great food and large portions. Friendly service awesome all the way around. I gave it 5 stars because it all they had it would get 10 stars from me.
Not as good as they used to be. Still a great value!
Good food and even better price!! The owners and staff were very accommodating even when we came in toward closing. Bring cash if you want the bar!
Terrific Green Chili and homemade tortillas! The service was friendly and the price was right.  This is a family run restaurant.
Ive been working here for years and i enjoy our customers soo much

name: Wing Shack
reviews: I've eaten there 3 times now, and been very satisfied 3 times now. I have 2 good friends of mine that work there so I know the food is quality. When I order to go, the wings are marinating in the hot sauce and pack an incredible kick. Cost is a little high but its incredibly good food so in my opinion well worth it.

Love me some wings! And they serve beer, which is a must with those spicy bites. I always order traditional (because I have testicles) and the skin must be crisp. They did a great job with this. One of my orders (golden hot) was drowning in sauce. Not a fan of this, but the wings stayed crisp, and the flavor was great regardless, so I can forgive. Another highlight, I like to request a side of the hottest sauce at every wing joint. Some are short on flavor, high on heat. Their Bear Hot is actually very good. Yes, it IS hot, but "bearable." 😂😂  The flavor was great, and if you dare, you can take their 10 wing challenge and get your goofy mug on their wall of fame. Give this place a try, it's worth the stop.

We ordered online and made sure we were there early   and by the time we got home all of the food was cold cold. The fries had no seasoning and the wings are way too small. The best part of the meal was the sauce and side salad, DEFINITELY not worth the $50 we spent.
Nice place for some chicken wings. Variety of flavors and just good food.

Great food and excellent customer service.   The wings were delicious and weren't over sauced.  The roasted peppers were great and not super hot.  They had a great deal for restaurant week and otherwise their prices seemed pretty fair.  Definitely better wings than BDubs.

name: Carol's Cafe
reviews: Adore the staff! Fun atmosphere. Lots of pastry options. Coffe is tasty!
A truck stop...you would not believe...great food at a fair price...wife could not believe that it is a yrick stop.  We have been there several times and ate going to return with friends.
Elegant luncheon, menu and buffet top notch, and the service was excellent!

I had a Reuben with seasoned fries and a bowl of chicken noodle... Ruben was cold way too much sauce and it didn't even taste like a thousand island sauce the fries were freezer burnt the chicken noodle soup was okay service was okay not great but okay
There food and service is great.

name: Five Guys
address: 1400 Dell Range Blvd Unit 85, Cheyenne, WY 82009, USA
reviews: Great burgers, great fries. Minimal decor but service is fast and friendly. Have eaten there many times. Try it if you haven't eaten there.

Update, over 2 weeks later, did not get a call back or email.  Dropping to 1 star. This is the 2nd time they've done something like this.  Customer service matters.

My ill wife wants a burger in a bowl.  After driving out and getting home, look what we find:  her bowl is missing the burger!  So I'm waiting to hear back from them after I called it in.

Good thing we ordered "all the way", or it would have been completely empty.  She says, "I'm disappointed that I have to check if my burger is in my burger."  So I gave her my burger.  I didn't want salad.  It's a bit of a laugh.

Food is very gross for the price. Fries soggy, limp and taste like starch. Forgot bacon and when asked I was given a bunch crushed pieces in metal tin. For the price would expect a little better food and service. 20 something year old manager flirting with my 14 year old daughter too, should be more focused on food then getting some. Wouldn't recommend.
Super slow. Not even busy and took almost 20 minutes. Usually good but burger died in the window waiting on fries.
Good burgers. Was missing a standard ingredient (mushrooms) on the choices though.

name: MrJims.Pizza Cheyenne on Vandehei Street
reviews: Just ordered a pepperoni and sausage pizza and decided to pick it up, as pickup was only 15 minutes and delivery was 40 minutes. Best pizza ever! It was hot, the crust was perfectly golden and it had a lot of sauce and toppings. Wow! Very impressed. 🙌

Easily 5 stars!  Mr. Jim's lives up to its reviews!!  I tried it on my way thru town from northern WY to CO.  Pizza was delicious!!!  The hand-tossed Garlic Parmesan crust was perfectly crunchy around the edge, but not burned.  Toppings were fresh, green pepper pieces were just the right crunchiness, cheese, pepperoni, ham, mushrooms were very good.  Not even really greasy at all, which is a huge difference plus for me.  I got the lunch deal, 10" any pizza for $5.95.  Definitely a GREAT deal!!  Would highly recommend dropping in for some awesome pizza.  (I didn't use any, but they even have coupons, and online deals.)  If I am ever out here again, I will definitely come back for a pizza.  :-) 👍👍  (Boy who took my order was very polite.)
Mr. Jim’s pizza is so delicious! And they support the locals schools. Thank you for excellent pizza and supporting the community

Stopped in on our way through and was looking for a quick bite and stumbled upon this gem. Was not disappointed. The crust was a perfect balance of soft and crunchy. The toppings and sauce ratio made it a flavorful pizza. Definitely recommend this place.
Ordered carry out and they brought it out to me in my car. Pizza is delicious!

name: Honolulu Poke & Ramen
address: 1400 Dell Range Blvd # 36, Cheyenne, WY 82009, USA
